description: Ole Rowdy Rooster is an unfiltered west coast style double IPA​ with light to medium hop haze, caused by the massive amount of dank American hops. The 'Rooster' has a juicy tropical fruit flavor and aroma, this beer pushes the limits of bittering without destroying your pallet. The 8% ABV is smooth and dangerous!
name: Ole Rowdy Rooster
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Inspired by the tried and true Vortex IPA, but bigger, hoppier and just as balanced as the Vortex that Fort George drinkers have been keen to since the brewery was almost scattered in a corn field.  The brewers at Fort George were making A LOT of Vortex, but just felt like it needed more umph.  After a rather strong early batch of Vortex in the pub, the regulars agreed, but this was not for the full pint.  This beer is not for everyone, but surely hoppy and big enough for many in the Pacific Northwest. Heavily hopped with Summit and Cascade hops, check out OMEGATEX.
name: OMEGATEX
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our Double IPA. OMNI is hopped with a 50/50 blend of Citra and an Experimental Lemon Zest hop. Focusing only on flavor and aroma, this IPA is bitter without punishment.
name: Omni Hop
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
According to Mayan and Hopi calendars the "transition from one world age to another'' will happen on December 21, 2012.

As an homage to the "transition" DC Brau has concocted an Imperial IPA named "On the Wings of Armageddon".

OTWOA is a single hop beer utilizing Falconers Flight. Brewed with just enough Pale malt, Cara-60, CaraPils and Malted wheat to carry the intense hop character onto the pallet.

At first glance, it has an orange hue in the glass with a viscus, rocky head that refuses to dissipate. Upon first sniff there are dominate aromas of citrus, white grapes and grapefruit with light bread and biscut notes. After the first sip we taste a mellow bitterness that only grows as more is consumed. Moderately carbonated, deceptively smooth, refreshingly dry and extremely heady for a beer at 9.2% ABV.

OTWOA exhibits all the necessary traits to be revered as a world class Imperial IPA.
name: On the Wings of Armageddon
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Brewed with Pineapple & Tangerine
name: On the Wings of Armageddon: Pineapple & Tangerine
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

Get this pig for a limited time at The Tasty Weasel Taproom before it turns to bacon.
name: One Hit Wonder Imperial IPA

description: Outburst Imperial IPA is a high-impact workout for the senses. A crafty combination of four different hops, and a dose of dry hopping, powers Outburst to 80 IBU strong. Its bold profile offers an aroma reminiscent of the Northwest hop fields at harvest time, along with spicy overtones of fresh citrus. Seeking a harmonious balance to the hop overload, we’ve blended four different specialty malts to create a distinctive deep amber hue and sweet caramel and roasty flavors.

description: Outta Focus Double IPA is brewed in the true Pacific Northwest style with expansive amounts of Pilgrim, Styrian and Cascade hops. Pleasingly bitter, floral and complex, our brewers take this beer to the next level with generous dry hop additions of Simcoe and Cascade hops.
name: Outta Focus Double IPA

description:
Overall IIPA is - as its name indicates - an Imperial India Pale Ale that has been created through close cooperation between the two beers and our good friends from Mikkeller. The starting point was to make a tribute to the American beer culture in which the beer should taste of something and have character, unlike the urine stained pseudoøl we often drink in Denmark!
At first sip, time stands still briefly before your taste buds will be bombarded with a hop experience dimensions, giving hints of pine, lemon and grapefruit and are only being reined in by the alcohol sweetness. You discover suddenly Bib IIPA is everywhere in your mouth and forget for a while tax debt, work, and the dishes and let their shoulders drop a couple of centimeters. You dream away for a moment before you realize that the glass was empty and you'll have to have another one.

Of the slightly more brews technical things can be said that it has been tørhumlet with not less than 20kg per hop. 1000 liters, so we're talking basically about a hoppy punch of dimensions!
name: Overall IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Overhead is an American-style Imperial IPA.  This beer is loaded with our favorite hops; Amarillo, Columbus, Centennial and Simcoe.  It’s bittered with a gigantic charge of Columbus and Simcoe early in the kettle that is followed by several rounds of late kettle and whirlpool hops using Amarillo, Centennial and Simoce.  In the end, Overhead is brewed with over 5 pounds of hops per barrel which includes two rounds of dry hopping to create a cascade of pine, resin and citrus hop flavors that consume your palate.  Although we brew Overhead with the same imported Pilsner and light crystal malts as Head High and ferment it with our house ale strain to produce a dry crisp finish, this blend of different hops creates an entirely new experience all its own.
name: Overhead
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: You will obey your overlord and drink this full-bodied IPA. You will enjoy the harmonious balance of its columbus, cascade, and centennial hops. You will be lured into our empire by its sweet, pineapply aroma and chinook dry hopping. You will be ruled by Overlord.

Bold and full flavored, this beer embodies the aggressive brewing practices that the US craft brewers have been known for. Here at NoDa Brewing, there's hops in our logo so you know we've been wanting to brew up an Imperial IPA since the beginning. Bold Pacific Northwestern hops combine with New Zealand hop varieties to give us a full Pacific hop assault in the form of Nelson Sauvin, Pacific Jade, Centennial, Columbus, Warrior, and Amarillo.  We then fortify the beer with delicious local Orange Blossom Honey. Don't worry... it won't attract bears, just new friends eager to share a bottle with you!

Palate Mallet is brewed periodically throughout the year.  It is available on draft at select restaurants, in 4 packs of 12 ounce cans at package stores, and in growlers at the brewery.

A complex double-brewing process of mashing and sparging with hopped wort and special hop layering are the techniques used during a hop crisis define this champion. An abundance of Centennial, Columbus and Simcoe hops challenge and stun hop heads with an aggressive hop-forward attack. Your palate will recover, but you will remember that last round forever.

The original Papa Doble was served at a Cuban bar called the Floridita. It was a daiquiri drink that had Double the alcohol. Our version of the Papa Doble is a bit different. Rather than mixing ice, juices and liquor we mix loads of Pale malt with hot water. Then add 40 lbs of American hops. This ale is all about the hops. Hops used are Nuggest, Cascade, Ahtanum and Willamette. This Double IPA is a hop heads dream beer for sure.

Pineapple Nuclear Nugget explodes with flavor. Strong pineapple flavor melds together with notes of citrus flowers from Centennial Hops and strong herbal and spice notes are added from Nugget hops. The fallout is somewhat subdued through the generous additions of local Virginia Honey from Bubba's Sweet Nectar from Waynesboro, VA.

Enjoy a break from life’s own battles with a Centennial Ninja.

You'll give it up to the Pirate King willingly.

description: Plasma (from Greek πλάσμα, "anything formed") is one of the four fundamental states of matter (the others being solid, liquid, and gas). Heating a gas may ionize its molecules or atoms (reducing or increasing the number of electrons in them), thus turning it into a plasma, which contains charged particles: positive ions and negative electrons or ions.
name: Plasma
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Imperial Rye IPA
name: Pleasure Island
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Pliny the Elder is brewed with Amarillo, Centennial, CTZ, and Simcoe hops. It is well-balanced with malt, hops, and alcohol, slightly bitter with a fresh hop aroma of floral, citrus, and pine. Best enjoyed FRESH! That is why we make it in such limited supply. Actual bottling date is printed on each bottle!
 
Where did we come up with this name? Back in the year 2000, our friend, Vic Kralj, who owns the Bistro in Hayward, California, decided to have his first ever Double IPA festival. Vic invited 10 breweries, 6 of whom (including us) had to brew something special for him since we had nothing that would fall under this style category. Vinnie had made a Double IPA at Blind Pig in 1994, but was not brewing one at Russian River Brewing at the time. He had an idea for the recipe, but not a name. After much research in beer books, brainstorming, and deliberation, we came up with "Pliny the Elder". Pliny, the man, lived in the first century- 23 to 79 A.D. According to our brewing references, he and his contemporaries either created the botanical name or at least wrote about Lupus Salictarius, or hops, currently known as Humulus Lupulus. That was a very early reference to an important part of any Double IPA! Pliny the beer has now become one of our flagship brews!
 
Pliny the Elder was immortalized by his nephew, Pliny the Younger, who wrote about his uncle succumbing to ash and smoke during the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in 79 A.D. while rescuing people. Cheers to the scholar, historian, officer, writer, and Roman Naturalist- Pliny the Elder!
Availability
name: Pliny the Elder
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Pliny the Younger, the man, was Pliny the Elder’s nephew and adopted son. They lived nearly 2,000 years ago! Pliny the Elder is our Double IPA, so we felt it was fitting to name our Triple IPA after his son. It is almost a true Triple IPA with triple the amount of hops as a regular I.P.A. That said, it is extremely difficult, time and space consuming, and very expensive to make. And that is why we don’t make it more often! This beer is very full-bodied with tons of hop character in the nose and throughout. It is also deceptively well-balanced and smooth.
name: Pliny the Younger
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This recipe packs 50% more grain and 100% more hops than the Ace IPA.
name: Pocket Aces Double IPA

description: It seemed no single beer could adequately convey the collective talents of Portland, Oregon brewing legend and Ecliptic Brewing founder John Harris; Luke and Walt Dickinson, the brewmaster duo behind North Carolina’s Wicked Weed Brewing; and Stone Brewmaster Mitch Steele. So, this veritable triad of power opted to brew TWO beers. The first was a traditional Belgian-style tripel aged four months in oak barrels that originally housed red wine, then tequila. It was then blended at a one-fourth to three-fourths ratio with a freshly brewed West Coast double IPA to create this beer. A variety of diverse flavors coalesce into something more unique than any one beer our trio could have conceived.
name: Points Unknown IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Polaris
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Poormans Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This IPA pours like the Oregonian sunset: hazy and bright. Sticky and resiny northwest hops meld with malt for a balanced, winding journey through old growth. Ride your fixie, put down your locally sourced coffee and drink Portlandic — before it was cool.
name: Portlandic IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Our head brewer’s ode to all that is hops. Thomas brewed this massive showcase of hops for the Alpha King Challenge during the 2014 Great American Beer Festival. Named for it’s 5 and 1/2 pounds of hops per barrel, Pound Town took first place and our hearts. Loaded with Mosaic, Citra, Amarillo, Nelson, and Simcoe.

1st Place – Alpha King Challenge 2014
name: Pound Town
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Giant, monstrous, and hopped to perfection. You need to get yourself down here for a taste and more. Honestly I thought this beer was finished before it was even dry-hopped it was so ridiculously hoppy. And then we dry hopped it with way too many hops, twice.. er three times.

Simcoe, Citra, Mosaic, Amarillo and friends. They play well together.
Believe me.
name: Power Plant
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Our seasonal Imperial IPA is a true beer nerds beer. A ton of 2-Row American grain helps us bring this in at 1.084 OG and ends up with at least 9.1% alcohol.

The beer pours with a slightly orange color and with a proper amount of white head.

The hops are the best part of the beer and a your nose can find Cascade, Centennial and Magnum.

In the true nature of a Double IPA, the alcohol is a big part of the mouth feel. This is a full strength beer and goes to show that you CAN in fact catch lightning in a bottle.
name: Prairie Lightning Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Constituting a beginning; giving origin to something derived or developed; original.” Need we say more?

True to its Imperial roots! This brew clocks in at 9.5% ABV, and over 100 IBUs! It is made with four varieties of grains resulting in a bold dark amber color and four varieties of hops, creating a subtle citrus aroma, and bitter, hoppy finish. Winner of a gold medal at the 2009 Santa Cruz National Organic Challenge, this recipe surely will not disappoint.
name: Primordial
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A Double IPA brewed with Other Half Brewing from Brooklyn. Our type of people. Our type of ritual. NC-grown six-row grain under a bouquet of Citra, Summer, and Centennial hops. Fermented with our house yeast blend.
name: Prismatic Eye
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Private Dancer
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Pro Pig Bantam Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Project Ale Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Project Clementine
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Projector Readymade
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Mosaic and a cast of supporting hops give this DIPA layers of tropical fruit and citrus with a bracing pine bitterness in the finish. Light English crystal malts add honeyed sweetness and a rich golden color.
name: Proliferous
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This is an almost one-dimensional hop monster that still sees Maris Otter put up a good fight in an attempt for malt balance.  But it’s really all about the hops, both bittering hops and aroma hops.  Familiar American hop character dominates at every level.  Promised Land is a very difficult beer to pair with food, but it can be done (with assertive flavors).  Despite its light color, please suggest it to be tasted last when possible as the hop compounds will obscure other beer flavors later in the same tasting session
name: Promised Land Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Unlike most IPAs brewed on the West Coast - our IPA not only has a ton of hops but is brewed with a strong malt backbone to help balance the bitterness.

Protector Imperial IPA is brewed with a variety of American hops and German malt. The hops dominate the flavor and impart pine, citrus and grapefruit flavors to the beer. Backing up the hops is a strong malt profile that adds unique caramel flavors with hints of toffee and honey. Combined the two produce a well balanced yet hoppy Imperial IPA.
name: Protector Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Psychedelic Cat Grass
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Psychedelic Pilgrim Oat IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Named after the isotope essential for nuclear grade weapons, this  “Weapons Grade Ale” is the hop bomb you didn’t see coming!
PU240 captures the explosive hop flavor and aroma necessary to acheive a critical mass that you won’t find in other high-hop ales. A classified and combustible amount of Summit and Galena hops along with a double dry-hop bombardment of Simcoe, Centennial and Amarillo contribute to PU240’s high rate of spontaneous hop fusion. Gold ~ CA State Fair 2011.
name: PU240
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Imagine puffing away on hops for days, then just chillin' as the party starts winding down.
But wait, a final burst of energy; one last dose in a tank of dry hops. A special hop bouquet for the afterparty.
If you love Resin, try tasting it straight from the tanks. That's PUFF - a hazy, unfiltered pour with an extra dose of dry hops... a new blend devised just for Puff.

We decided to capture our own puffy, cloudy brew in a limited release can. First puff says it all - this ish is Keller. Breathe deep and put your head in the clouds... it's Mad Science.
name: Puff
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Puget Sound Giant Hoptopus
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: XXXX IPA is a non-traditional American IPA with a brilliant copper color and the classic citrus nose of Cascade hops. This beer demonstrates a unique balance of malt-inspired, delicate red grapefruit sweetness and lingering hop dryness. The OG and final ABV provide the structure and body to balance the harmony of distinct flavours. Cascade, Warrior, Summit and Glacier Hops are used for bittering and Cascade Hops are added for dry hopping after fermentation. This hop blend is well balanced with Malted Wheat, Pale Ale, Crystal, and Caramalt Malts. To fully enjoy all the flavours, this ale is best drunk at 55 degrees Fahrenheit. This beer pairs well with Cajun dishes, blackened fish, and BBQ. XXXX draws its name from the British brewing convention of using XÃ¢â?¬â?¢s to denote style. 70 BUÃ¢â?¬â?¢s, 1.092 OG, 9.25% ABV.
name: Pugsley's Signature Series XXXX IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Ever been punched in the face with a fist full of hops?  Well pucker up, because at 100 IBUs you’re about to take one straight to the kisser.  Weighing in at 9.2% ABV, this brew isn’t a love tap, it’s a haymaker.
name: Punch You In The EyePA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: So mega-hopped it will take you to hop heaven. We’ve used hops in the boil, more hops in the giant hopback, and added to that, an incredible amount of dry-hopping for that cutting-edge “hop bite.” Once you’ve tasted this unique beer, all others pale in comparison.
name: Pure Hoppiness
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Pussalia
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Pussy Wagon
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Double Red Rye IPA
name: Q-Hut Red
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: There’s nothing like Quaanto… except more Quaanto.  A triple IPA.
name: Quaanto
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Quad Hop Double Dizzy IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Quadtum Leap
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Quarter Mile
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: R.I.P.A. on Rye
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rabbit's Reserve #7: Thrice Hopped Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rabbit’s Reserve #2: Imperial Red IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rabid Hop
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Racer X is an uncommon Double India Pale Ale which puts a California twist on English brewing traditions by adding an assertive hop aroma and bitterness that compliments the firm malt backbone. Like its little brother Racer 5, Racer X is balance in a bottle.
name: Racer X
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rad 2 The Max
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rage
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Special beer to commentate italiracan’s farewell. A super hoppy, dry double IPA fermented with a brand new yeast and dry hopped with tons of galaxy, matueka, simcoe and Amarillo hops. Ragno Araña!
name: Ragno Araña
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rainmaker Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Raja
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A massive brew that is enormously aromatic with huge hop flavors wonderfully structured with a great malt body.  The flavor comes on with huge notes of citrus, pine and resin which last into the crisp dry finish.
name: Rampage Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
A burly and bitter Imperial IPA, Rampant pours a pure copper and carries the sheen of a rightly hopped beer. The Mosaic and Calypso hops bring stonefruit to the front seat, and the addition of Centennials nod towards citrus for a well-rounded aroma. The taste expands these hops with heavy peach tones and a profoundly bitter bite. There is some malt sweetness to stand this beer up, and Rampant's finish is bone-dry.
Prominent lemon citrus and floral hop aroma and flavor including some nice dry-hopped fresh grass and spicy pine notes.
name: Rampant
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Ranch Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Right now everyone is talking about the financial crisis, and last year was the hops crisis. At Amager Brewery we say "fuck all the crises and let's have some serious beer!" With Rated XX 2009 we will once again prove that despite rumors to the contrary, then there are plenty of hops to get out there if you which brews just want it. This beer is a tribute to the beer perhaps most precious ingredient, and it is a tribute to all the 'hopheads' who knows how to enjoy it. Again we have gone berserk and emptied hop room at the brewery. Amager Rated XX 2009 contains a unique composition of no less than 23 hops: Centennial, Hallertau Mittelfrüh, Brewers Gold, Crystal, Simcoe, Pearl, Mt. Hood, Hersbrucker, Challenger, Fuggles, Liberty, Styrian Goldings, Columbus, Chinook, Amarillo, Bramling Cross, East Kent Goldings, Willamette, Palisade, Saaz, First Gold, Pacific Gem and Northern Brewer. Yep, we admit it outright, it's a hop-orgy that will separate the wheat from the chaff among beer lovers - even among those who have believed that their taste buds could easily cope with a violent Double IPA. When it comes to bitterness, then we have given up trying to figure it out, because it is quite impossible. But we're pretty sure that Amager Rated XX 2009, one of the world's most bitter beer. Enjoy - if otherwise you dare!
name: Rated XX
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Once during a tour of Amager Brewery took an elderly lady one hop pellet from the exhibit glass. She thought it was a piece of Vienna malt and munched joyfully on the small pill. Joy was soon turned to horror when the cruel truth with one went up for the nice, elderly lady. She's still alive, but her taste was forever scorched away at it, there just should have been a pleasant day at the brewery.
The above story is true down to the smallest point, and the lady is certainly not proud of it. But I retell it to warn of the total carelessness with hops, which takes place on Amager Brewery. A year brewed the a heated double IPA with 20 different hops. The following year would blærerøvene surpass themselves and sprinkled 23 hops in the keg. This time, they ended up at 30 hops, yes you read that right. Three to ten hops. And now it's not fun anymore, it's just perverse. Lads know obviously not what they're doing - it is pure Disney. The said lady would go in acute convulsions if she so much as sniffed at this beer. And you tend to hop shock, we can not recommend this beer. It is hereby Rated XxX - then you are even asking for it!
name: Rated XxX
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Just love making IPA's, so here's another one that uses the hop blend called Zythos that is just delicious and should be enjoyed with a blow-up doll or something similiar.
name: Ratsalad
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: RAVN Nordic IPA: In the darkest reaches of Scandinavia, brewers infuse century old ingredients for devilishly hoppy IPAs. We’ve combined the potent character of juniper,rye, and oats, and hopped it with unholy amounts of Simcoe, Chinook, and Columbus hops. The result is a piney and resinous Black Ale.
name: RAVN Nordic IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Rayon Solaire or Solar Ray is a Double French IPA with a very simple Malt Bill, American and New Zealand hops and French Yeast Strain.  Clocking in at 8% ABV and 70 IBU, Rayon Solaire boasts a beautiful blonde color; big, bold, tropical fruit nose; spicy flavor and a smooth, slightly bitter finish.  You better put on your sunblock and sunglasses if your gonna soak up some Rayon Solaire.
name: Rayon Solaire
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: RBF
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: American-style double IPA brewed with local Pinnochio's Beer Garden To Go. Brewed with Galaxy hops that give it a passion fruit character in the aroma and flavor.
name: Real Boy 2xIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Bursting with tropical fruit flavors of mango, pineapple and passion fruit this bone dry take on the style lets the Zythos, Chinook and Falconer's Flight hops shine.
name: Realization
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Batch 1. A big beautiful bold IPA with a huge aroma and a resinous piney punch. If you don't like big hoppiness, this beer isn't for you.
name: Rebel Raw Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This Double IPA is brewed with a blend of American and Australian hops and is packed with fruity citrus and pine notes for a bold hop finish.
name: Rebel Rouser Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A brutal, bitter, bastard of an double IPA. Some say I went to far with the chinook hops when brewing this.....I say I didn't go far enough. This is not for the faint at heart or the uppity light beer drinkers of the world. 8.5% abv. with IBU's to high to count. Drink at your own peril.
name: Red Bastard Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Red Betty Imperial IPA is dry hopped with whole leaf hops from the Yakima Valley, combined with Maris Otter English barley, which is floor-malted in age old tradition. A long maturation ensures plenty of flavor, with strong aromatics of grapefruit, tangerine and mango.
name: Red Betty Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A double IPA bringing out the monster hop aromas and flavors San Diego is known for while still maintaining drinkability so you can have a second!
name: Red Flag Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Red Racer Imperial IPA is dry hopped with whole leaf hops from the Yakima Valley, combined with Maris Otter English barley, which is floor-malted in age old tradition. A long maturation ensures plenty of flavour, with strong aromatics of grapefruit, tangerine and mango.
name: Red Racer Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An aroma of pine, with a hint of melon, gives way to the body of this chewy, caramely IPA. Finishes with a punch of juicy, citrusy hop flavors.
name: Red Shed Red IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Red Zone is a red double IPA that has been brewed only with centennial hops. This beer boasts floral and citrus notes throughout. A hop forward IPA with a malt backbone, it packs a punch for sure. Sit down with a good friend and enjoy!
name: Red Zone
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Let our Redeemer show you the way to eternal hop bliss, through bountiful amounts of American West Coast hops added throughout the brewing process.  This beer is reserved for hop lovers; if you don't like hoppy beers you are at the wrong set of gates.

Cheers!
name: Redeemer
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Redonkulous
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A big late hop addition and big dry hop fills your mouth with a juicy, well-rounded nectar. This Vermont style IIPA is brewed with only Michigan grown hops and is surprisingly sweet and approachable.
name: Relativity
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Remnant of the Dragon
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Renegade Black, the color of the night sky, begins with an alluring aroma that mixes slight roast and floral characters with the strong American hop notes of pine and citrus. Medium bodied, the taste begins with a lingering, but not overwhelming, bitterness and then ends with a nice dry finish.
name: Renegade Black DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Renegade White is deceivingly light in both color and body.  This West Coast style DIPA starts with pine and citrus in the nose.  These elements then carry into the mouth with added notes of grapefruit and a pleasantly dry finish.
name: Renegade White DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Whatever flames upon the night.
Man's own resinous heart has fed.
A beer that celebrates the extraction of hop resin for a concentrated yet balanced brew. View the story of the Resin below.
name: Resin
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Resinator is named for the resinous hop oils that lend aroma and bitterness to beer. While very hoppy, the Resinator finishes with a malty balance that may be comforting to those who tend to steer clear from bitter beers.
name: Resinator
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A deceivingly crushable West Coast Double IPA with intense fruity American hop characteristics
name: Resistentialism
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Resurgens Rye
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Retribution
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Simcoe Hopped DIPA
name: Rez Gets Smashed
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
On the hot side, Rhizing Bines will go through Dogfish’s signature continual-hopping process with floral and citrusy Bravo hops. On the cold side, it will be dry-hopped with an experimental varietal so new it doesn’t yet have a name, just a number: Hop 644. A component of Sierra Nevada’s aroma-boosting Torpedo system will make a pit-stop in Delaware for dry-hopping duty before it heads to Sierra’s new North Carolina brewery.

To celebrate Sierra Nevada planting East Coast roots, Dogfish Head tracked down a Carolina heirloom wheat grown and milled at Anson Mills. The soft red winter wheat contributes subtle sweet and nutty notes to this hop-forward ale.
name: Rhizing Bines
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rice Reaper
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Ahh Dey Ahh Dey, RRRRico Ahh Dey Ahh Dey Saaaauvin!

An India Pale Ale featuring Nelson Sauvin hops. Named after the Sauvignon Blanc grape, is a variety of hop developed and grown in New Zealand. It has a strong fruity flavor and aroma that is described as resembling white wine, or fresh crushed grapes or gooseberries. Some reviewers of this hop perceive the fruitiness as being very tropical with descriptions including passion fruit, tangerines, and grapefruit. These hops are organic and are about 4 times as expensive as our normal American varieties, hence the footed glass only.
name: Rico Sauvin
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Tropical fruit notes like pineapple, passion fruit, and mango married with pine and grapefruit pith. Featuring Simcoe hops.
name: Riff
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An abundance of American hops balanced with a hint of malt to produce an exhilarating experience of intense hop flavors and aromas.
name: Rip Cord
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rippa Dipa
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Triple IPA
name: Rise & Shine
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rise Of The Angels
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Our Double IPA needs to be as big and bold as the history makers we celebrate! 

The name has two meanings: On one hand it lovingly refers to our town’s long history of overcoming adversity, both of the manmade and natural variety; On the other hand the name is a literal reference to Sacramento, when after the devastating floods of 1850 and 1861, the people came together to actually raise the city a whopping 34 feet to prevent further catastrophe! Bottom line: this is a really big beer. 

A strong cast of Galena, Columbus, Citra and Equinox Hops join forces with an addition of fresh, organic juniper to set off a land mine of herbal and citric flavor on the back of your tongue. 

Using our double-secret hopping technique, this Double IPA is smooth as silk yet packs a wallop of vibrant hop flavor!
name: Risen City
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Road 2 Ruin
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our Imperial Rye IPA is brewed in the name of our Road Warriors—the sales team who tirelessly hit the streets, traveling from town to town and pub to pub sharing the Green Flash experience. Road Warrior™ charges full flavor forward. Columbus and Mosaic hops, rich crystal and spicy rye malts pave the way for Mosaic and Amarillo dry-hopping to boldly shine through in the finish. Raise a glass to those who never settle!
name: Road Warrior
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: RoboHop Imperial IPA is not a beer to trifle with. The unfiltered beer pours with a deep orange hue with a bright white head. The aroma is fantastic. Tropical fruits abound from the glass, which consist of passion fruit, guava, lemon with notes of white grape and evergreen mingling together. Makes you think of cotton-candy. Traces of soft warming alcohol notes are also detected. The full-bodied 8.5% Imperial IPA is very gentle on the palate, making it one sneaky bugger. Many of the aromas come through in the taste, resulting in a very pleasant juicy finish that’s slightly dry, and, as stated in the description – bracingly bitter. An easy-drinking Imperial IPA.
name: Robohop Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Rock Dodger is our salute to the many beer-loving bicyclists across Iowa, especially those who regularly traverse the 75-yard gravel path from Gray’s Lake bike trail to Confluence Brewery for a pint.


 We started with American two-row barley malt, Belgian pilsner malt and just a touch of specialty caramel malt. Then we added a blend of hops — including Citra (the star of our popular South Side Citra Ale), Crystal and Simcoe. The result is a beer in which the sweet malt is balanced by moderate bitterness and infused with tropical and citrus fruit flavor and aroma. For a big ABV double IPA that’s as smooth as a freshly paved bike path, try Rock Dodger.
name: Rock Dodger
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rock-N-Rolla
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rocket IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This imperial IPA rocks...hardcore.Citrusy, resinous and aromatic, ready yourself for bursts of caramel, incendiary tropical fruit notes and bright hits of grapefruit and pineapple, before a spiky bitter dry-hopped finish. Though packed with exciting flavors, Rockhound arrives light on the palate and after a journey through a mystical hoppy land, finishes dry. Those in search for the elusive easy drinking imperial IPA have truly found a gem.
name: Rockhound Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
It’s a job.  And a hazardous one at that.  Benefits, you ask?  I hardly think so.  

But the show must go on.  So, it’s with bravado that the Rodeo Clown takes his place in the arena lights.  Whether or not he’s insane is not important right now.  It’s with grit and intensity that the Clown steps in the path of almost certain destruction.

Our Double IPA is much the same.  At 9.5% ABV, Rodeo Clown Double IPA coats the tongue in bitterness and packs a punch that will knock a bull on its ass .  Intense and maybe a little insane drink carefully, but drink often. Ladies and Gentlemen, let the show begin.
name: Rodeo Clown Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Rollin’ Rosie is proof that some of the strongest hits come in small packages. Better known as “Queen of the Track,” Rosie is a hard-hitting asset to any lineup. Brewed with Amarillo and Simcoe hops, Rosie is a perfect blend of bitter and sweet, and to say she hits like a girl is absolutely right: full-bodied, well-balanced, and strong. Just like any good roller derby player, Rosie will knock you off your feet!
name: Rollin’ Rosie
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Roudy IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Route 138
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A royal family of juicy, sticky, resinous hops unite with the most honorable of funky & fruity farmhouse yeast strains & four noble grains to produce this king of farmhouse DIPAs. A fanfare of dank tropical fruit aromas announces this big Double IPA and then stands at attention with the backbone of Belgian Pale malt, rye, spelt, & oats. The fruity esters of our Farmhouse yeast and a touch of residual sweetness make this one very powerful IPA. All hail the king!
name: Royal
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Royal Donk
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Royal Roar
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Ruination 2.0 W/ Mango, Chipotle, & American Oak
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Draft Only
name: Ruination Double IPA 2.0 w/ Orange Peel & Vanilla Bean
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: So called because of the "ruinous" effect on your palate! This massive hop monster has a wonderfully delicious and intensely bitter flavor on a refreshing malt base. One taste and you can easily see why we call this brew "a liquid poem to the glory of the hop!" Those who seek, crave and rejoice in beers with big, bold, bitter character will find true nirvana in Stone Ruination IPA!
name: Ruination IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Ruiner
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: We first released this decidedly indelicate beer in 2012, as Stone Ruination Tenth Anniversary IPA, to celebrate the 10th anniversary of our belovedly bitter Stone Ruination IPA. Stone RuinTen IPA uses the same recklessly hoppy recipe as the 2012 release; only the name has changed, as we plan to unleash this belligerently delicious hop monster upon the public annually from now on. We packed a whopping five pounds of hops into each barrel, and cranked up the ABV to stand up to the hop onslaught. The results are glorious, and we know you'll rejoice in tasting this audacious gem of hoppy splendor once again. You're welcome.
name: RuinTen IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This version of Stone RuinTen Triple IPA imagines orange peel and vanilla bean being caught moshing with the hardcore hop legend. Its original inspiration starts back with our decision to take the 2002 release of Stone Ruination IPA and make it into an even hoppier monstrosity in 2012 for its 10th Anniversary. Soon after its release, the nickname “RuinTen” began to circulate, and eventually stuck. No sooner did we sell out the special release that our fans began to clamor for more of this veritable hop monster, and from their noise the annual RuinTen release was born. Not being ones to not mess with a good thing, we decided to add two new ingredients to produce this modern-day mosh pit of hops: orange peel and vanilla bean. The result is a melee of flavor. Dive in, or watch from the seats. Your call. You’ll find us in the pit.
name: RuinTen Triple IPA w/ Orange Peel & Vanilla Bean
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: West Coast Double IPA.  Two stomps are better than one!
name: Rumplestiltskin
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Run For The Hills
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Port Jefferson is known for its Ferry service to and from Bridgeport CT. This insanely hopped brew starts with mash hops, ultra generous additions in the boil, and finishes with a healthy dry hop. We’re sure after a couple of pints the Helmsman wouldn't execute the smooth landing you’re used to. Pick the dock in the middle!!!!
name: Runaway Ferry Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Runaway Imperial IPA is a high gravity ale that has a  pronounced hop aroma, with a refined malt body that balances the hop bitterness to achieve a smooth, yet flavorful, Imperial IPA!
name: Runaway Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Russian Doll is our latest fantastic voyage into the essence of beer. This time we’ve used the same malts, hops, and yeast - the differences are down to the ABV. There’s a great complexity when trying the beers side by side - the aromas & flavours from extra pale, cara and dark crystal malts vary from biscuity through caramel, toffee and treacle as you might expect, but the hops (simcoe, citra, cascade and centennial) present differently from style to style - from zesty to tropical through stone fruit to jammy. The labels feature exclusive artwork by Esther McManus.
name: Russian Doll - Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our Imperial RyePA has grapefruit notes and just enough rye to give it a slight spiciness. Finishes sweet with a great mouthfeel.
name: Rye Baby IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Rye beers have been a part of our brewing arsenal from day one. “Rye”, “Rye Squared” and now “Rye Cubed” Triple IPA completes this trilogy of brewing excellence.
name: Rye Cubed
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A double rye IPA dedicated to a man that made the world a better place. In magic, Three Floyds.
name: Rye da Tiger
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rye IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Rye Level Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A hearty American double IPA, red in color from a significant rye contribution. Spicy rye notes complement the dose of Simcoe and Centenial hops.
name: Rye Not?
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Double the malt, double the hops, and double the flavor of the original Rye Pale Ale recipe. (Hence the name Rye Squared.) With its mammoth hop aroma, bitterness and flavor, this beer is not for the faint at heart. The Rye Squared clocks in at a hefty 9.5% ABV so double your pleasure and double your fun because Terrapin went a little crazy with this one!

Annual Release: February

The high content alcohol of these beers make them perfect for cellaring…hide them away and pull one out for a special event 2-3 years later.
name: Rye Squared
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Ryeclops is dominated with a mouthful of distinct rye malt character complimented by the spicy fruity hoppiness of American high-alpha simcoe hops.

Use caution when confronted with the Ryeclops, as it’s delightful aroma and complex flavor camouflage a might, boozy-backboned single-hopped monster of a brew!
name: Ryeclops Imperial Rye
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Ryelander is a beer that’s easy to wrap your head around: it’s a big, spicy, hoppy Imperial IPA. It ravages taste buds, decimates olfactory receptors, and leaves even the heartiest neuron begging for mercy.

It is brewed from a blend of pale, crystal, and rye malts (with just a touch of roasted barley for color). We add many pounds of hops to the boil, and many more directly to the fermentation vessel. The result is an undoubtedly aggressive beer, but like its namesake, it shows a surprising depth and complexity.
name: Ryelander
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Another unique Rye beer from BRBC, this Double IPA is brewed with large quantities of American hops and fermented with Belgian ale yeast to create a bitter, hoppy, and spicy ale that is sure to delight.
name: Ryevalry
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
S.N.A.F.U is a double IPA, AKA DIPA, heavy hopped and high alcohol. To pack in as much hop character as possible we hopped it in the mash ton, first wort, bittering addition, flavor addition, whirlpool (aroma), and dry hops in fermenter. With the 6 combined hop additions and 5 distinctive varieties of hops this double IPA is a hop head masterpiece at over 100+ I.B.U’s. Malt profile was kept relatively simple to keep the hop character predominate yet not overwhelming. Every hop used was a US variety with exception of German Mandarina Bavaria with is an aromatic hop with strong notes of tangerine and citrus that was recently released in 2012 and a pedigree of the famous Cascade hop.  All in all this is a double IPA that truly backs up its name. 
Systems Normal All F**Ked Up.
name: S.N.A.F.U
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Prehistoric IPA with potent notes of Papaya, Mango and Peach yet finishes with crisp clean citrus bitterness.
name: Saber Tooth Tiger
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A well balanced Double IPA, slightly resinous up front with a crisp floral finish.
name: Sacred Hop
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Safety 3rd
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Mango Habanero Imperial IPA.  It tastes heavenly spicy, with a bountiful amount of mangoes and hops to provide pleasure to your tastebuds.  Intense…. Spiced with Habanero peppers
name: SAFEWORD
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The main event for hopheads has arrived! In the right corner we have lively botanicals hailing from the high desert; in the left, heavyweight citrus hops are looking for a knockout. Get ready to take a punch and keep on swinging with this bold Imperial IPA brewed with sage and juniper berries that’s best shared with those in your corner.
name: Sagefight Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The color is deep amber with a light, creamy head. The nose starts off with a touch of citrus but then turns decidedly into peaches. The taste starts off with creamy malt resulting from the pale 2 row and caramel malts and Saint Arnold yeast. The hop bitter starts low then builds to a crescendo, but always maintains a balance even in its big finish. The hop flavor continues to be peaches, an interesting manifestation of the Columbus, Simcoe and Centennial hops. This is the first Divine Reserve that we have filtered. This decision was made to make the hop flavors brighter, plus it would have been a bottling nightmare with all the hop bits in it. This beer is best enjoyed at 45° or even a little warmer. Though the recipe and style indicate this beer to be enjoyed fresh, we expect this beer to develop interestingly over the years.
name: Saint Arnold Divine Reserve #11
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: It’s really hard to groove on the nose of this beer for very long without wanting to take a sip.  The aromas just kind of beg you to partake, so I shall.  This beer nears 100 theoretical IBUs.  As such, you’d expect it to kick the crap out of your pallet and send you home to suck on ice cubes.  Not here though.  The beer starts with that same sort of tropical sweetness you get in the nose.  It’s very soft and easy on the tongue — really enjoyable.  Somewhere around mid-pallet the grapefruit/pine/dank taste creeps in, just in time to keep the beer from being cloying or juice-like.  The finish is probably the only point in this beer where the bitterness really becomes evident, lingering with a grapefruit pith kind of feel, drying you out ever so slightly, begging you to take another sip.  And so I shall.
name: Salute
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Samsara is an Imperial India Pale Ale brewed with rye malt, which gives it a sharp, slightly spicy malt character. A unique blend of four American hop varieties boost the bitterness levels and make for truly unique hop flavor and aroma profiles.
name: Samsara™
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Samurai
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Samurai Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
To commemorate the the opening of Benchmark Brewing Company, we made a hugely hoppy and strong (9.5% ABV) Double IPA.  
We were named the 71st brewery in San Diego County, and we decided we needed to make the 71st Double IPA. Based on the response, we may brew San Diego 71 again.
name: San Diego 71
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: YOU be the judge! No, this isn’t a typo…1 “P” is all you need. Named for the legendary UD law professor, Rich Saphire, Saphire 1PA is a Double IPA brewed in that classic citrusy West-coast style using hops from Rich’s beloved stomping ground of San Diego. Easy to mispronounce, maybe, but it’s also easy to drink. Refreshing with a bitter bite, Saphire 1PA finishes with a delicate sweet malt finish…but only after your taste buds recover from the hops! Much like Rich Saphire, the tenured high ABV makes a strong case and commands respect. Already affectionately known as “1P” around the brewpub, Saphire 1PA awaits your judgment!
name: Saphire 1PA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Saranac Imperial IPA is part our new High Peak Series, a line of beers that are bigger, more complex and flavorful; beers that are meant to be sipped and savored. Saranac Imperial IPA is brewed with 10 different malts and 10 different hops to make a delectably flavorful and complex Imperial IPA.
name: Saranac High Peaks Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Saranac Wet Hop IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Strongly and aggressively hopped. Legendary flavor, like the beast itself.
name: Sasquatch Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
This Double IPA finishes at 8.25% ABV, and has a bitter bite at over 100 IBUs. As far as the dominant hop goes, three pounds of Centennial hops per barrel give our double IPA a slightly punishing yet entirely pleasing bitterness that dances on the tongue.

Part of our Limited Asylum seasonal series, Satisfaction Jacksin is available on tap and in six packs at your favorite craft beer outlet from September through December-ish.
name: Satisfaction Jacksin
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Satisfied Mind
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Saxon Action
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A triple IPA brewed for San Francisco Beer Week, and as the name states, this beer will not be brewed regularly. With 50% Citra and 50% Centennial hops, the tropical/citrus flavors and aromas are intense. This beer finishes smooth and dry, with little residual sweetness.
name: Scarcity IIIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Scratch #20 has been dubbed Apollo Imperial Ale because of our experimentation with a new hop variety.
 
Apollo hops are high alpha acid with an intense aroma. Married with other high alpha hops, with almost two pounds of hops added per barrel produced, AIA has an intense staying power in the back of the throat. After a long discussion between Chris, John and the brewers, they dubbed this hop flavor stinky grapefruit with a hint of perfume. The dark color might lead you to believe the some malt may shine through; but no, the hops are the true player in this ale.
 
Scratch #20 has a dual role, also serving at The Drafting RoomÃ¢â?¬â?¢s Anniversary Ale for 2009. We brewed a bit more to serve the brewery and The Drafting Room, but get it while when you see it. Before this intense hop flavor subsides, this beer will be sold out.
name: Scratch #20 2009 Apollo Imperial Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
The hop "research" continues in the Scratch Series with #38, our second of four Imperial Pale Ales. Featuring Centennial and Chinook hops, #38 adds a heavier malt bill and pours a brilliant golden amber with a creamy off-white head that leaves abundant lacing down the side of the glass. Unfiltered like nearly all of our Scratch beers, #38 has stunning clarity: even our lab guy thought we filtered this one!
 
Due to some serious dry-hopping, #38 has a predominantly grassy citrus nose, and the flavor follows suit, overwhelming nearly all the bready Munich malt used in this brew. #38 leaves a lingering grassy bitterness on the tongue, making sure you know a lot of hops were sacrificed for this brew.

Hops: Centennial, Chinook
name: Scratch #38 IPA (2011)
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
With 2011 coming to a close, we are in the mood for hops! Our brewers have been filling up the hop dosers and hopback with ridiculous amounts (and blends) of hops while learning to tame our new twin brewhouses.

Scratch 55-2011, a Double IPA, has the subtlety of a hop sledgehammer. Yep, there’s a nice amount of color and sweetness from a massive blend of Munich and Crystal malts, but the playmaker here is a bevy of mouth-puckering hops that create a taste bud-numbing blend of pine and grapefruit that begin in your nose and linger long after your glass is empty.

Tread gently beer lovers as this high-ABV level is masked by the big hop flavor.

OG:	 18.8
Malt: Pils, Munich, Crystal
Hops: Nugget, Simcoe, Cascade
Yeast: House Ale Yeast
Codename: Double IPA
name: Scratch #55 Double IPA (2011)
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Scratch Beer #218
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This double IPA uses seven hop varieties and is dry hipped for a complex flavor profile. There is subtle building bitterness, mild maltiness, and notes of pine and citrus.
name: Screeching Otter DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Second Coming
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: One delicious Double IPA.  Big aroma.  Lots o’ hops.  Citrus smooth and juicy.
name: Second Fiddle
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: You just may fall in love with this DIPA. Its intense hop kick comes from a healthy dose of Mosaic hops.
name: Secret Admirer
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Secret HOPeration – Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: See The Light
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Foothills' first high gravity beer. The high level of bitterness in Seeing Double is well balanced with just enough malt character to craft a drinkable double IPA. Expect a full body and hint of citrus from the variety of hops added to this brew.
name: Seeing Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Seeing Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Seeking Alpha
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Don't fight it, Spite It!

We see you on the Internet, pixelated and hungry for attention.

You just posted a selfie, and can't wait for the validation.

"Beautiful."

"HOTT."

"SEXY."

But not this time.

This selfie is going to cost you a punch in the nuts and a loss of self-worth.

We discovered that our honey IPA is a natural duck face repellent.

Citric and dry, with a delightful addition of honey.

Redeem yourself, wiener.

Following our four easy steps in the only known cure for the selfie pandemic.
name: Selfies Are For Wieners Double IPA With Honey
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Serendipity IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Serum injects the Double IPA style with a fresh dose of big hop flavor. This medium- bodied amber nectar boasts a thin tan head, big hoppy floral bouquet, slippery, luxurious mouthfeel and strong 9% abv. While aggressively hopped at several stages of the brewing process, including a gradual two week dry-hopping, Serum remains incredibly well balanced by a smooth malt sweetness and  through to its lingering, bitter finish. First released as a seasonal beer in 2004, but now available all year round, so get your dose!
name: Serum
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
"...stings the nostrils..."

We didn't want to make your mother's Double IPA. Sex Panther was made with an off-kilter, Belgian-leaning malt bill, imparting some dark fruit characteristics to this otherwise insanely American-hopped beer. Citrus comes from a couple of the big C's, and of course the 10-pound Amarillo dry hop. 60% of the time, it's hoppy all the time.
name: Sex Panther
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Shane’s Big DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
This beer is the combined effort of Urbain from De Struise Brouwers and Three Floyds Brewing Co.  On the 3rd of May Urbain came to our Indiana brewery and we created an 8.7% ABV ale using the Struise house yeast with some medium crystal malts and a portion of oats at a calculated 260 IBUs.  Urbain will brew the same beer at Struise when the Three Floyds crew travels to Belgium at the end of this month.

This beer was brewed in loving memory of a former employee, Rich Sheppard, who recently passed away, a portion of the proceeds from this beer will go to his family. Try this beer and enjoy the Rich life.
name: Shark Pants
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Shart Pants: A Tribute
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A  rich amber color with medium malty backbone. Strong, complex hop flavors with aroma of fruity, citrus, spicy, earthy, minty notes from 5 additions of galena, centennial, nugget, and northern brewer hops. Dry hopped  with centennial and Northern Brewer.
name: Shattered Glass Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Shipwrecked Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Sort of part British ipa, part English barley wine.
name: Shipwright Imperial British IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Good things happen when you have a good time with good people. In The Garage, we call this “shoptalk” — sharing stories, ideas, and dreams with our friends. That’s what we did with Widmer Brothers in Portland, Oregon to collaborate on this Imperial IPA. Shoptalk features a bigger body, more alcohol and more overall bitterness than a standard IPA. While working with the Widmer Brothers team, we decided to use a hop combination of new and experimental hops to create a pungent tropical fruit aroma and flavor including grapefruit, tangerine, currants, and a slight hint of pine. Unlike our other beers, this beer was not meant to be balanced – the focus is all on the hops.
name: Shoptalk
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This double IPA has a light malt backbone that lays a somewhat blank canvas for the hops to shine. 72 pounds of hops are used in this beer throughout the process, and is continuously dry-hopped at the end of fermentation. Notes of pineapple and orange zest are showcased in the aroma and flavor.
name: Short Session
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Shortfall IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Huge Bitterness with a robust malt backbone
name: Shot Tower I2PA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The shotgun house is a New Orleans classic.  Fire a shotgun through the front door and it will pass out the back door and never touch a wall... or so the story goes.  Shotgun Double IPA is wall-to-wall hops with plenty of pale malt.  First hopped in the brewhouse with multiple varieties, including Amarillo, then dry hopped with Simcoe, Sitra and Cascade.  A blast of intense flavors and aromas of pine, citrus and tropical fruit.
name: Shotgun Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Shovelhead 2X IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Showdown is an IPA reimagined. With a heaping addition of hardy rye, this copper-hued beauty delivers an unmistakable spicy rye character, while a burly dose of American hops evokes the piney aroma of untamed wilderness. Balanced, bold, and brave, Showdown claims the prize.
name: Showdown Rye IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: ShuBee Do
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Brewed with 12 different hop varieties, intense tropical fruit and pine aromatics.
name: Shucker's Dozen
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Shuttle Bunny DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Simcado DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Spring House Brewing’s newest Double IPA showcases one of their favorite hops: Simcoe. A big, bitter, dank ale that is dominated by the citrus flavors of Simcoe. The use of Chinook, Amarillo and Simcoe in this ale were no match for the Simcoe Brute. Simcoe Must be Destroyed!
name: Simcoe Must Be Destroyed!
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A new clan of Ninja is ready to do battle with your taste buds. A true warrior, the Simcoe Ninja’s only foe is the bland. With massive notes of pine and citrus, Simcoe Ninja will slash at your senses and leaves you thirsty for another bottle.
name: Simcoe Ninja
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Simcoe Showers
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Simcoe Simcoe Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The second beer in our Nation of Hops Series, Simcoenation is a 100% Simcoe-hopped Belgian Double IPA packed with piney, fruity, delicious hop flavors.
name: Simcoenation
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Simtra Triple IPA delivers a punch in the face with its very danky hop aroma derived from Simcoe and Citra hops.  You wanted more hops you got them.
name: Simtra 3x IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Single Batch - Double India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The show sold out before you even knew the tickets were on sale. Be in awe of the access to the excess.
name: Single Hop Citra
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Single Hop Ella
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our single Hop Imperial IPA's showcase the most rare and interesting hop varities, something all too apparent with HBC-291.  It's so new, it doesn't even have a name.  And this juicy little number proves that a hop without a name smells and tastes just as sweet.
name: Single Hop HBC-291
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: HBC-431 is a hop so new, it doesn't even have a name. It has a unique combination of tropical fruit, citrus and melon with distinct earthy notes. Try amping up the spice on light proteins with this monster.
name: Single Hop HBC-431
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Single Hop Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Single Hop Mosaic IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: While that damn Dionysus was taking all the glory, Simcoe, Greek God of Beer and Relaxation, was out, diligently developing tools for man to brew- fresh grain and hops, active yeast, and bountiful water. With its golden glow and sharp hop bite, our Imperial Single Hop IPA is a tribute to this lesser-known God (and as temple-worthy as its namesake).
name: Single Hop Simcoe
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: As the line of soccer moms and just-clocked-out dads spanned the lengths of five front lawns, the neighbors began to wonder about young Timmy's lemonade stand.
name: Single Hop Sorachi Ace
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Choosing from the most rare and interesting varieties, our genius team of brewers is releasing four Single Hop Imperial IPAs in 2015. Each has the same grist bill to highlight the individual hop variety.
name: Single Hop Warrior
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Sinister
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Looks can be deceiving. Pitch black color tells the brain one thing, while the nose and tongue yell something different. An ungodly amount of our favorite American hops fall into an abyss of dark maltiness with an unusually light roast character for its color. Sinister Minister Black IPA makes its debut in the Cicada Series and we compel you to drink now.
name: Sinister Minister
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
An unsettling development has arisen in mainland Europe which BrewDog have found impossible to ignore.

Armed with their 40% ABV beer, German brewers have infiltrated our front lines, slipped under the defences and straight onto the radars of you – the noble beer drinkers of the Empire.

We ask of you to keep calm and carry on whilst saluting the valiant efforts of Tactical Nuclear Penguin whose fall has allowed the Germans to recapture the world record for the strongest beer.

We are wheeling out the big guns this time. Sink the Bismarck is a quadruple IPA that contains four times the hops, four times the bitterness and frozen four times to create at a staggering 41% ABV.

This is IPA amplified, the most evocative style of the craft beer resistance with the volume cranked off the scale. Kettle hopped, dry hopped then freeze hopped for a deep fruit, resinous and spicy aroma. A full out attack on your taste-buds ensues as the incredibly smooth liquid delivers  a crescendo of malt, sweet honey, hop oils and a torpedo of hop bitterness which lasts and lasts.
name: Sink the Bismarck
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Here in Amager, we are pleasantly far from Jante Country, we are not afraid of excesses and moderation is us infinitely distant.
 
In fact, it is just now that we consider gluttony as a virtue rather than a sin - at least when it comes to one thing: Hops! We have found the hops which shone most brightly in hops space and almost begged to be used in large quantities.
 
And so we did - as befits a Double IPA of the highest order. We have overly indulgent in sinful degree - and we like it! I wonder if even you?
name: Sinner Series Gluttony
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
I like big hops and I cannot lie / You other hopheads can’t deny /
 If you like ‘em bitter and juicy / Taste this juicy double/Hop-a-Lot’s in trouble / This beer’s got hops!
name: Sir Hop-a-Lot
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Siren
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Back in the day, Michael Peticolas' brother, Charlie, was a cop and COPS filmed a few of his arrests. The best of which involved a deadbeat considering resistance to his arrest. With baton drawn, Charlie demanded "Sit down or I'll SIT YOU DOWN!" Since the episode aired over 10 years ago, we've uttered the line a million times to one another and laughed every time. We're paying tribute to that line by using it to name our Imperial IPA. A big beer that will sit you down if you don't do it first. Ha. Call it “Sit Down” for short.

 As for the beer itself, the intent is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of the hops. We dry hopped it with over a pound of hops per barrel of beer. It’s gold in color and the floral ester aroma is high. The hop bitterness is high, but not at all harsh. The hop flavor is high, fresh, and lively. Yet with all of our beers, it’s all about balance and this one is no exception. The malt character is fairly high and provides a tremendously full mouthfeel. Finally, the alcohol in this beer is intentionally present (and delicious).
name: Sit Down or I'll Sit You Down
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Twice the amount of hops as our Eight Point IPA. Light bronze in color with tons of citrus & piney hop notes. Hopped with Centennial Columbus and Simcoe hops.
name: Sixteen Point
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This giant boot will leave a permanent hop stamp on your tongue. Brewed once yearly. Sold in 750ML capped bottles and on tap at the STB tap room.
name: Size 11
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Skankin Dirty
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Our first bottled release with subsequent ever-changing iterations. Big, bright tropical fruit hop character against a backdrop of sweet caramel and malt, with smooth pronounced bitterness and hints of wood and cognac-y booze.

Best enjoyed after winning a street fight, whilst wearing nipple clamps and taken as a suppository.
name: Skunkworks
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Skye Strong Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Named after Boise's Slaughterhouse Gulch and its historical meat packing businesses, this brew is as bold and rugged as the miners and packers that traveled its path when it was known as "The Oregon Trail". This fall seasonal is an India Red Ale featuring Amarillo hops, known for their dark, fruity characteristics. While higher in alcohol by volume, a roasted malt base offsets the hops and balances the heat of the alcohol for a subtle, rich finish.
name: Slaughterhouse
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Sledgehammer
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Don't be afraid to walk with this dream, dive into this earthy, overly bitter, potent brew that will ensure your senses have more than their fair share of enjoyment.
name: Sleep Walker
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Sleeper Cell
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Slippery Slope
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Double IPAs - you're on notice. Small Axe Big IPA is a golden hued IPA that's deceptively strong and full of tropical hop aroma. Cascade, citra, centennial, nelson sauvin, and nugget hops combine to form an aroma and flavor that's straight up tropical, with heady notes of pineapple, orange, mango, guava, and grapefruit.
name: Small Axe Big IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Small Green Everything
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Smells Like A Double Michigan Safety Meeting
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A collaboration triple IPA brewed with Aptos St BBQ; this beer is full of danky resinous hop aromas and flavors. A simple malt bill allows the Columbus, Apollo, Mosiac, and experiment 07270 hops smoke you out. Sit back and enjoy the DANKNESS!
name: Smoke N’ Dank
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Special Limited Release, Smoked version of our Dangerously Drinkable Beast, Swamp Ape DIPA.
name: Smoked Swamp Ape DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Smuttlabs:  Shebang
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Smuttlabs: The Stallion
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A big, joyous celebration of all things hoppy (5 different varities). Large flavors and aroma of pine, citrus, flowers, spice, pineapple, and grassiness complimented with a touch of biscuit and caramel backbone. Our most requested beer.
name: Snake Handler
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: DoubIe the PaIe and Victory maIts and hopped with Nugget and Cascade. Fruity overtones finish off this rich, copper DIPA. Very hoppy yet well balanced.
name: Snake Pro DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An Imperial IPA brewed with flaked rice in order to keep the body light in order to showcase the New Zealand Motueka hops. Pronounced tropical fruit flavors and aromas hide a big 9.3% ABV.
name: Snap Crackle Hop
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Sneaky Goose Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Sneaky Pete is a blend of five hop types: Simcoe, Glacier, Centennial, Vanguard and Hallertuaer, with Simcoe playing the dominate role at 30%. In addition, three separate malts were used: Honey Malt, Rye Malt, and Munich Malt. The brew has a copious aroma of white grapefruit, citrus overtones, a complex rich middle and long flavors in the finish; a real beauty. Finished with wild clover honey.
name: Sneaky Pete
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Snowball Earth
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Release #2 is essentially an Imperial version of James, our Black IPA.  Brewed with buckets full (literally) of Simcoe and Columbus hops, in the kettle and, as dry hops, in the fermenter.  This Imperial Black IPA is a mere 9.5% abv and heavily, heavily hopped…
name: Society and Solitude #2
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Release #3 is brewed with a blend of our favorite hops (Simcoe, Chinook, Columbus, Summit) and dry hopped with much of the same.  It is slightly reminiscent of an Imperialized version of Harlan.
name: Society and Solitude #3
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Sock Knocker
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our take on the traditional India Pale Ale, our Double IPA is brewed with Pale and Crystal Malts.  It is dry hopped with a generous amount of Simcoe hops.
name: Sofa King Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Softly Spoken Magic Spells
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Solar Abyss
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A storm is brewing and with it comes a wicked carnival of hops. The dark carnie leader’s skin is emblazoned with many a vine, including Columbus, Cascade, and Sorachi Ace. So whether you’re a Halloway or a Nightshade, you had better run, for with this carnival, Something Hoppy This Way Comes.
name: Something Hoppy This Way Comes
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Son of Bitter 2 (SOB2)
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Son of Malice
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Americans like MORE! Especially when it comes to hops. So we took the IPA, ramped it up and dumped in loads of hops. This creates a beer with a slight alcohol presence and complex hop aromas of citrus, floral, and herbal notes. Malt sweetness helps to balance the substantial bitterness in the finish.
name: Son Of Wrath
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Songs of Freedom
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Like the two-time Gold Cup steeple chase winner that gave our ultra-aromatic double IPA its name, Sonic Charm starts with a burst of flavor right out of the gates.  A tropical juice bomb of guava, passion fruit and pineapple is tempered by the bright flavors of sweet grapefruit, orange peel, and citrus.  With little to no bitterness, and 8.3 alcohol by volume, you’ll have to watch this one as you reach the finish line in record time.

Brewed with locally harvested spruce tips and tracking in at 103 IBUs this aggressive double IPA won’t leave you wondering if you caught a whiff of pine; rather you’ll know you bulldozed through the forest and came out on the other side – the dark side – the Black Husky side.

description: We pronounce it “sta-leep-ah”… you pronounce it how you like. STLIPA, which is the acronym for St. Louis India Pale Ale, is actually a DIPA (Double or Imperial IPA…i.e., double the stats of a traditional IPA). We hope it’s a ‘sleeper’ that you’ll include in your set of favorite DIPA’s from one of the best beer cities in the world…St. Louis. Hops- Sterling, Cascade, Mt. Hood, Willamette, Chinook.
name: STLIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Stone 10th Anniversary IPA harkens back to our earlier Anniversary Ales, with abundant hopping at many stages of the brewing process. Appropriately, the aroma is over-the-top, with pronounced piney and resiny hop flavors combined with tropical fruit esters and more subtle notes of toasted malts and alcohol. Our Stone 10th Anniversary Ale weighs in at 10% alcohol by volume (perfect for a 10th anniversary beer), and has a little more color and malt character than our other IPAs. In addition to using the new Summit hop variety in the brewhouse to provide the powerful bitterness, we went back through our records and found some of our favorite hops over the years, and used them to flavor this brew, including Chinook, Crystal, and large doses of Simcoe in the dry-hop to provide a huge, complex, piney, fruity and floral hop character. This is a colossal beer, big in every sense: hoppy, malty, rich, and strong! Right up our alley.
name: Stone 10th Anniversary IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: After brewing this intense double IPA with more than 10 different hops and consistently delivering it faster than any bottled IPA on the planet, we decided to do something different with this Stone Enjoy By IPA—we took it to another level, again. Puréed tangerines were added to the batch to create a devastatingly fresh IPA with a tang of tangerine. The flavors yielded by this addition to the recipe meld beautifully with the bitterness of the hops. True to this series, Stone Enjoy By Tangerine IPA is brewed specifically NOT to last, and should be enjoyed within 37 days.
name: Stone Enjoy By 10.31.16 Tangerine IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Stone Ruination IPA was the first full-time brewed and bottled West Coast double IPA on the planet. As craft beer has evolved over the years, so too have techniques for maximizing hop flavors and aromas. For the second incarnation of our groundbreaking India pale ale, we employed dry hopping and hop bursting to squeeze every last drop of piney, citrusy, tropical essence from the hops that give this beer its incredible character. We’ve also updated the name to reflect the imperial-level intensity that’s evident in every sip. Join us in cheering this, the second stanza in our “Liquid Poem to the Glory of the Hop.”
name: Stone Ruination Double IPA 2.0
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
The Story:
During the winter months, the Sun sets behind Lolo Peak, and on the coldest evenings, a rare massive sun pillar may appear. A sun pillar looks like a thin column that extends vertically above the sun. The sun pillar is prominently visible when the Sun is low or lies below the horizon. It normally forms an arc that extends from five to ten degrees beyond the solar disc.  Sun pillars are formed by reflection from ice crystals with roughly horizontal faces.
The Beer:
The Sun Pillar Double IPA is a more robust version of our 3 Needles IPA. It features a more intense hop profile and higher ABV. The resulting beer is perfect for people looking to enjoy a, frankly, bigger IPA.
name: Sun Pillar Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: It's back and only on draft: The Alpine Beer Co. and New Belgium have come together for the love of IPAs. This collaboration is hop-wonderful with Amarillo, Columbus, Simcoe and Centennial hops, bringing the bitter all the way to the front. A nice balance Is present with Pale, C-80 and Carapils malts, but the tropical and citrus tones of the American hops dominate. This Super IPA pours a sheened copper and carries a bright, white head. Consider yourself a hero for getting an Alpine beer outside of San Diego.
name: Super IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
