description: Super Snapper is a strong, roasty, hoppy, complex ale—kind of like a Red Snapper meets an IPA. We started with the Red Snapper recipe and added 150 pounds more Pilsner malt, 20 pounds more caramel malt, 7.5 pounds more Cascade bittering hops during the boil, and an extra pound of Cascades to dry hop in the fermenter. The result is a hybrid ale that is a deep reddish copper with a medium body, rich roasty malts, and zesty, citrusy hops on the palette. It has a long bitter finish that derives from both the roasted malts and the 47 IBU. Super Snapper was brewed to commemorate Arbor Brewing Company and the Brewpub’s tenth anniversary.
name: Super Snapper Very Special Bitter
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An American Double IPA with a large but basic malt bill that explodes with a perfume of resiny hop aromas! The lack of sweet specialty grains allows the hops to seize the flavor focus contributing bright tasty qualities of citrus fruit, berries, and even a mild spiciness. The perfect bitterness resonates across palate complimenting the awesome hop intensity within.

In the bottle, that directive is deftly delivered by the great Centennial, Chinnok, and Columbus hops of the Pacific Northwest.  Only BC-malted 2-row barley is good enough to echo the Superpest name, so that's what we use...

We send our approach for the Svea IPA. As your growing thirst is leaning towards more bitter levels, we have carefully selected a set of noble hops, for you to enjoy on every suitable occasion.

The IPA is made with Barley, Oats, Wheat and Rye…not to mention, a Struise twist. I can’t help but wonder if the TTB will think of “twist” as some kind of perceived medical benefit and outlaw it on the U.S. version of the label. Extra note: 65.6 IBUs with and end gravity of 1015.

description: Firsthand accounts describe an intense beast with a potent aroma and bite. Proof that the elusive mystery monster exists? Or proof that brewing with five distinct varieties of hops creates an unbelievable, relentlessly hopped Indian Pale Ale? One taste and you'll know, Swamp Ape is real.  Florida Beer Swamp Ape IPA is an Imperial India Pale Ale. The fresh and lively hop character is derived from using 5 distinct varieties of hops; Tettnang, Centenial, Chinook, Cascade and Amarillo.  This beer has an intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma balanced by complex alcohol flavors, moderate fruity esters and a medium malt character.  2010 Bronze medal winner at the U.S. Open Beer Championships.
name: Swamp Ape DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Talon Double IPA, like birds of prey whose formidable talons empower them to hunt and survive will more than satisfy you in your hunt for hops. But Talon Double IPA is much more than just hops. Our skilled team of brewers have developed this Double IPA featuring intricate layers of enigmatic flavors with their artful use of 5 unique premiuin varieties of malt ~ Specialty 2-rovv, Wheat, Crystal, Munich and Vienna, and 6 distinct varieties of hops ~ Cascade, Apollo, Centennial, Pilgrim, Summit and Amarillo ~ before a round of intense dry hopping with Cascade, Amarillo, Summit and Simcoe hops. The result is an abundantly fragrant hop nose with a bright hop flavor layered throughout in perfect harmony with a rounded malt body. Talon Double IPA finishes bold, strong and fulfilling, and demands many repeated explorations of this supremely enjoyable IPA. Talon Double IPA is 10% ABV with 95 IBU’s and is indeed an IPA that will take a firm grip of your taste buds.


Your taste buds are Waiting, so go for it!!
name: Talon Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Our 10 Bitter Years has been voted Canada’s best Imperial IPA. For us it celebrates a decade of survival in the craft brewing industry. It was first brewed as an anniversary beer when Black Oak turned ten. Categorized as a Double IPA, it has perfect balance between caramel malt body and hop bitterness. Double dry hopping, using three different varieties of hops, creates lots of flavour and hop aroma.  You’ll smell pine, grapefruit, mango and pineapple. All that malt and hops balance it’s exotic character and provides just enough alcohol warmth to enhance the flavour.  The exact ingredients are top secret and we are sworn to secrecy. It’s so popular we can’t keep it in stock (Please take smaller sips).
We hope you enjoy our special edition anniversary beer.
PS Ken’s still bitter.
name: Ten Bitter Years
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Brew 10,000: One Brewer, Eighteen Years, Ten-Thousand Batches of Beer. 

Brew 10,000 is not so much a style of beer, rather it is a new recipe using some of the best ingredients John Maier has ever brewed with... Vienna, French Special Aroma, and Maris Otter Pale Malts; Yakima Summit and German Saphir Hops, Free-range Coastal Waters, and PacMan Yeast. 

Brew 10,000 was brewed only once, so its allocated and very, very limited. Its packaged in the swing-top 750-ml ceramic bottle and available only at select retailers. Note, Brew 10,000 was sold out at the brewery in early 2007, however, very limited amounts may still available in the retail trade, email Schuyler@rogue.com for a retailer near you.

style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: THAT'S IT! We're throwing down the gauntlet. Literally. If you haven't tried craft brewed beer before, put the bottle you're current-ly holding down and start somewhere else. This is not a good place to start. The Gauntlet is one seriously intense beer that should be reserved for only the boldest beer revolutionaries in the world. The inordinate amount of hop flavor and aroma that radiates from this creamy, froth covered liquid is enough to make this Brewmaster blush. If that sounds good to you, you can safely break your time on this earth down into 2 categories; the time before you tried The Gauntlet, and the time after. If not, the $5.00 50 packs are on the left.
name: The Gauntlet
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

The Goats Obsession finishes clean and invites you to drink another one and become obsessed. It pairs well with spicy grilled meats; strong cheeses like Stilton or a cloth bound cheddar and sweet dessert like Crème brûlée.

description:
“Double IPA is a style we were excited to brew – it’s a further exploration beyond the Belgian-styles we are known for historically,” said Phil Leinhart, Brewmaster for Brewery Ommegang. “Nirvana received such a great reaction, of course we wanted to see if we could take that to another level.  And I’m really excited we are sharing this beer nationally – unlike Nirvana which we restrict to our heartland, fans everywhere can enjoy Great Beyond and tell us what they think.”

Great Beyond pours a hazy light copper color with a thick white head. The aroma is intensely fruity thanks to massive hop editions; notes of mango, pineapple, and apricot dominate the nose, with underlying hints of sweet citrus. The flavor is full of juicy, fruity hop character with resinous pine undertones. The body is pleasantly full with a silky mouthfeel and big balanced bitterness. The finish lingers, finally resolving to a pleasant hop presence. Great Beyond is 8.8% ABV and 83 IBUs, a true palate-wrecker.
name: The Great Beyond
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Hope you have a hat ready to toss away, because this IIPA is about to score a hatrick on your taste buds. Chocked full with an all-star blend of 6 legendary hops with a malty backbone to hold it all together, this grain bill is stacked like the ’93 Western Conference Champions led by The Great One himself.
name: The Great One
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: The Green Gecko
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A long time ago in a brewery far, far away. . . . (Double Black I.P.A.)
name: The Hop Strikes Black
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The Hoplander is a big, bold double IPA made with Summit, Columbus and Falconer's Flight hops.  The sturdy pale ale backbone has a deep copper color and a caramel malt flavor that edges its way to the tongue through a pallet slam of intense hop flavor and aroma.  Try if you dare!
name: The Hoplander Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Inspired by Frank Lloyd Wright’s grandiose vision for a mile-high skyscraper dubbed "The Illinois," we set out to brew an imperial IPA that would be similar in name and ambition. "The Illinois" Imperial IPA is dry-hopped with three of our favorite hops: Cascade, Meridian, and Citra. the result is a harmoniously hoppy ale with a flavor and aroma that is uniquely Goose Island.
name: The Illinois
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: The Impaler Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The Imperial IPA is a Double India Pale Ale that is fully loaded with Cascade hops for explosive grapefruit flavors and aroma, assertive bitterness balanced perfectly with a strong malt backbone, and a slow, smooth finish. Montana grown 2-row pale, white wheat, and caramel malts. Simcoe and Cascade hops.
name: The Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: The Implication
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Brewed with pilsen malt and a ton of rice, Iron Mallet was built to be light in color and body with a huge burst of flavor and aroma from the Amarillo, Centennial and Galaxy hops.  You'll have to taste it to believe it...there's a pretty good chance you'll be changed for good.  Remember, hops make you happy; Iron Mallet makes you ecstatic.
name: The Iron Mallett
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our Imperial India Pale Ale; light and sweet malt profile with a huge hop punch.
name: The Jabberwocky
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A Monstrously Hopped Triple India Pale Ale.
name: The Kracken
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Another version of NIP's well known Double Rice IPA. This rendition loaded up on Amarillo hops, raised the bittering units, and increased the ABV  to give you a well balanced full flavor brew to keep your IPA interest satisfied through the winter months. Accentuated with tropical tones of apricot, citrus, and mango the alcohol is very well hidden giving way to a clean and crisp finish.  And as always I'll now finish with a stupid ass pun that will feature a cameo of the name of the beer: If you drink enough of these the beer will certainly have The Last Word. Enjoy Folks.
name: The Last Word
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Liberator was made as a 30th birthday gift to Joe Short. As a double IPA, this beast employs a sizable malt bill, but it is the crazy amount of hops added to the boil every 4 minutes, for 120 minutes, that really make this beer special. Fruity, floral, and piney hop flavors penetrate throughout the caramelized malt profile. Liberator is a well-balanced, full bodied brew that has a bitter finish due to the post fermentation addition of lemon and orange zest. The original batch brewed on the Bellaire system had 42lbs of hops in it, compared to Huma, which has around 20lbs of hops per batch. Today’s Elk Rapids batches have up to 138lbs of hops. The name, Liberator, came from Joe’s name for the Short’s employees who carry out our company’s mission statement as “Beer Liberators”, freeing the masses from their misconceptions surrounding beer.
name: The Liberator
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The encore to Hoppiness is a Warm Pun. This beer is made with Citra and Simcoe hops to create an incredible flavor of tropical fruit. The beer is named after Tyler's own little brother who, despite the title, is the biggest of the family.
name: The Little Brother
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Maharaja is derived from the sanskrit words mahat, meaning “great”, and rajan, meaning “king”. Much like its namesake, this imperial IPA is regal, intense and mighty. With hops and malts as his servants, he rules both with a heavy hand. The Maharaja flaunts his authority over a deranged amount of hops: tangy, vibrant and pungent along with an insane amount of malted barley – fashioning a dark amber hue and exquisite malt essence. Welcome to his kingdom!

The Maharaja is the second installment in our Dictator Series.
name: The Maharaja
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: The Murray Project
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Rich, roasty, almost creamy malt character with a strong hop aroma of fresh tilled earth and grass. The body is full but does not overpower. The hop bitterness is strong but has the distinct Valiant rolling character. Hop flavor lingers long after finish.
name: The Ol' Switcheroo
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: The Problem Solver
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The Professor is here to enlighten your senses. This Double IPA boasts a crisp citrus bouquet with a smooth body that hints of caramel and honey.  The Professor finishes his lecture with a dry, ample bitterness masking the 8% ABV of this hearty English style ale.  If you are a hop-lover, this beer is sure to educate.
name: The Professor
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
The Roustabout is a deceptively strong beer with an intense hop character that includes both citrus and pine notes.

Our double IPA is medium in body and pale in color.  The bitterness is well-balanced and the beer finishes dry.
name: The Roustabout
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A palette wrecking double IPA featuring centennial, columbus, chinook, and cascade hops.
name: The Seaward DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: “Can I scream….” for more hops? You sure can. Two row American barley jammed packed with as much Apollo, Newport, Simcoe, Topaz, and Citra hops we could get our hands on, The Shape of Hops to Come is an 8.5% ABV American-styled imperial IPA hopped with Apollo, Newport, Simcoe, Topaz, and Citra hops that’s got a ton of bitterness, along with juicy, dank resiny pine-like, and citrus forward hop character that is worthy of it’s name. Dry hopped for two weeks this hop bomb has as much hop power we can muster!
name: The Shape of Hops to Come Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Family always comes first. Just when you thought that your poor tongue couldn't stand any more humulus lupulus, The Sister comes home to prove you wrong. Using the same unbreakable malt backbone of The Brother to balance out a truckload of Calypso and Bravo hops, The Sister weighs in at approximately a billion IBUs.
name: The Sister Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An American West Coast Double IPA that focuses on lots of bright, aromatic hops. It pours a clear golden color with aromas of grapefruit and  pine.  It has a medium body with a nice hop bitterness that balances out the beer and makes it very easy to drink.
name: The Stickman Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Full Disclosure: This beer came to fruition because we saw a gap in our portfolio and we wanted to increase our market share. Sometimes the truth hurts. But most often, it’s damn refreshing. The Truth Imperial IPA--the latest addition to our year-round portfolio-is a hop bomb of some of the most distinct Pacific Northwest hops available today. Its sharp hop bitterness begins with huge pine notes on the nose, which evolve into bright citrus (think grapefruit) and subtle stone fruit flavors.
name: The Truth
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Imperial IPA (w/ Pineapple & Dry-Hopped w/ Citra)
name: The Truth (Pineapple & Citra)
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: British soldiers stationed in India receiving their daily beer ration would never have expected this. The Vicar’s Cross has all the bitterness a double IPA demands, yet it is remarkably smooth and well balanced.
name: The Vicar's Cross
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: The Walter
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Science will try to tell you that the human tongue cannot detect more that 80 IBU of bittering; this hop-centric Imperial IPA certainly will not leave you wanting for more. Big, bold hop aromas and flavors of citrus, pine, and tropical fruits are bracketed by malty sweetness. Sit down, relax, and leave all your worries to the Therapist!.
name: Therapist
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: There Was Only Fire
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Belgian Double IPA fermented with English and Belgian ale yeast, Belgian candi sugar, Hallertauer hops, and American Oak chips.
name: Thing II
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Bright and intense with a vivid hop punch. Third Voyage features Cascade hops from different growing regions throught the world. The unique conditions of soil, moisture, and sunlight from each yield subtle differences that make this beer a complex medeley of hop notes.
name: Third Voyage
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This One Time at Band Camp is our Double IPA with an Evil Genius twist - we never use the same blend of hops twice! We start with a classic American DIPA recipe, then cut back on the bittering hops by adding over 75% of the hops post fermentation. This method helps retain their juicy, resinous, aromatic qualities, allowing the differences in the hop varieties to really stand out. Each time we brew this beer, we will dry hop it with a different blend of hops - sometimes with classic American hops, sometimes with rare and expensive New Zealand or Australian hops, and sometimes with exciting, brand new varieties of hops.
name: This One Time at Band Camp
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: This Side of Paradise
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Thorin
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Three Lions is another one of our celebrated Brewers’ Cuts that has made the transition to year round status. Our Imperial IPA dons a helm of copper color with subtle toffee notes, but this ale is all about the hops. Its pronounced hop character is provided by two huge dry hop additions of Simcoe, Amarillo, and the newcomer Lemondrop. The complex blend of tropical and citrus hop flavors and aromas, coupled with a clean dry finish makes this a deceptively drinkable ale. Now available in a bomber, there is enough to share with your pride.
name: Three Lions
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Three On the Tree
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Double IPA, 5 different grains and aggressively hopped - this is a very well balanced Double IPA.
name: Thumb Master
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Thumbprint Series: Scream IIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Tiberius IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Packed full of Columbus, Citra, and Mosaic hops, it’s no surprise that this DIPA sports an intense hop-forwardaroma and flavor profile where each sip begins refreshingly juicy and sweet before shifting to an immense, mouth-coating hop-bitterness that’s sure to please the true hop enthusiast.
name: Tidal Shift DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Tidal Wave
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Double IPA hopped with Galaxy, Columbus, Amarillo, and Chinook.
name: Tiny Tornado
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Tomahawk
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This beer hopped with Citra, Galaxy and Simcoe hops is not for the faint of heart.  Balanced nicely with a malt sweetness from the copious amounts of barley we put in, this beer will strip the enamel from your teeth and leave you begging for more.
name: Tony's Car
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our mamas always taught us that you can never be too polite. In their honor, we decided to test that theory with the Too Kind. It has everything you love from the Kind IPA but jacked up to an out-of-this-world level. A hop exuberance of pine, citrus and love that plays nice with others.
name: Too Kind
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This big Double IPA features some old favorites, Amarillo/Simcoe and one of our new favorites Azacca. Notes of Citrus, Ripe Mango and Orchard Fruits.
name: Too Many Cooks
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The saying “less is more” doesn’t apply to West Coast IPA’s. Less is a glass half empty and Tower 20 is a full glass of unrivaled hop character – a Double IPA where more is more. In brewing this hoppy offering, we took the best of Tower 10 IPA and added more. An abundance of high-alpha Centennial hops give T20 its resinous pine-like bitterness, while Oregon-grown Crystals and Chinooks lend zesty grapefruit and tangerine hop flavors. Don’t hoard this hop bomb, drink it fresh and we’ll brew more.
name: Tower 20 IIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Town Beach
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: TPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Inspired by the Orphic bone tablets which explore the dichotomous nature of life and death, our Bone Tablet series reveals the many sides of the IPA. Transmigration of Souls is an irresponsibly hopped Double IPA, bursting with life from an absurd amount of aromatic hops. You’ll experience a bouquet of orange, lemon, and tropical fruit sitting on top of a clean, dry malt body.
name: Transmigration of Souls
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Tré Kind
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Think of Trebuchet as a catapult, slinging the hops of this Double IPA in every direction, all balanced by a sturdy backbone of malt and our beautiful Belgian yeast. A Brewer's Reserve Limited Release.
name: Trebuchet Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Tree Bucket
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Colorado…we really love your peaches, wanna shake your tree! Tree Shaker Imperial IPA was brewed with 3,000 pounds of pureed Colorado peaches. The bright citrus hop character and subtle fruity sweetness will get your feet tapping and your taste buds dancing.
name: Tree Shaker
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This Imperial IPA was triple-batched, using a different hop and crystal malt in each batch.  We then dry-hopped it with the same three hops during fermentation. The end result is an intensely hoppy, high gravity beer with caramel undertones.
name: Tri PA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Tribale Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our Tribute Double IPA is a celebration of hops, pure and simple. A simple and smooth malt base serves as the stage for the hops to perform. Tribute has a beautiful golden color, an aroma brimming with citrusy hops, and a deliciously smooth hop flavor and dry finish.
name: Tribute
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Tricerahops is double everything you already love in an IPA. More hops, more malt body and a higher gravity define this Double India Pale Ale. Fiercely flavorful, guaranteed to satisfy.
name: Tricerahops Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Brewed in our 8.5BBL System, this dry, strong and hoppy beer includes Columbus, Nugget, Simcoe, Chinook, Azacca, Citra & Mosaic in the boil kettle followed by 2 dry hops, once with Simcoe & Citra and then again with Amarillo & Mosaic.
name: Trident Triple IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: As if DRIPA wasn’t enough, we first brewed this Triple Rice IPA for our 2013 Summer Solstice Celebration. The larger grain bill and longer boil leads to a big malty character, yet the hops are still at the forefront, all sticky and citrusy. The finish lingers a bit longer than DRIPA, but is still clean and dry with just a bit of heat.
name: TRIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our Triple Blitz IPA, like our Eye Crosser IPA, is intensely hoppy. It resembles a stour in color and has flavors of espresso and chocolate and a dry hopped character. The alcohol content is very high. Beware.
name: Triple Blitz IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Triple Bombshell Blonde
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Triple D IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Brewed originally in 2010 to celebrate our one-hundredth batch at the brewpub and the third installment of our Fist series, this is one seriously hoppy ale! A beautiful burnt orange hue and a underlying caramel flavor to balance out the hop bitterness. Aromas of fresh-cut tangerines and mango from Citra, Cascade, and Chinook hops. The rest is up to your imagination.
name: Triple Fist
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A light malt body with a sweet onset which is complimented by slight citrus undertones and finishes smooth with slight hop notes (Caution: This is our strongest)
name: Triple IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Triple IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Hops. Hops! HOPS! Huge waves of pine, grapefruit, citrus, and a hint of earth jump from the glass. A slight heat from the high alcohol content dissipates with the initial wave of malt and the second waves of hop flavor and bitterness. This is a long sipper, drink dangerous!
name: Triple IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A high alcohol triple IPA with a light body, full mouth feel, and brewed with specialty hops.
name: Triple IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This lupulin-laden India Pale Ale is packed with juicy tropical character, bring floral aromas and exceptional layers of flavor. Store cold, pour carefully, then close your eyes and enjoy a tropical vacation in a glass.
name: Triple Sunshine IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Hybrid style, Belgian Triple / Double IPA. The malt body and fruity Belgian yeast notes compete with an aggressive hop schedule of all American hops. Dry-hopped with the very floral Citra hop varietal gives this brew the aroma of a seriously hopped-up IPA.
name: Triple/Double
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An Imperial IPA built on experimental hops grown in the Alsace Region of France. Triskel is like no other IPA you’ve had before. Bold yet refined, laced with hints of lemon and orange flavors. This medium bodied work of art will stop you in your tracks and make you think of all that’s good in life – You’re Welcome.
name: Triskel
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
The seventh release in our limited Legendary Series is inspired by a ridiculously bizarre tale involving a princess who falls in love with a boy, only to be denied by a greedy troll demanding a toll for the boy’s soul. Action, romance, sweet karate moves, and some over-the-top production ensues, but to no avail as the princess eventually loses interest.

This bitter, twisted tale influenced our hoppiest brew to date, a West Coast-style Double IPA with seven varieties of hops, including Simcoe, Amarillo, and Citra. It should appease even the most offensive trolls. It could very well make you a master of karate, too.
name: Troll Toll
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Simple grain bill of pale and Munich malts let the hops shine through like a ray of light after a tropical storm. Expect big tropical fruit and citrus notes balanced out by a solid malt backbone.
name: Tropic Thunder
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Feel the tropics and enjoy the burn! This high-gravity Double IPA is loaded with hoppy and citrus flavors. The nose begins with sweet and fruity mango, pineapple and grapefruit aromas, accompanied by a slight tang of alcohol. The initial sweet citrus flavors slowly blend into a dry and lingering hoppy bitterness. Australian Galaxy and Citra hops are dominant and balance well with the large addition of fresh mangos. This beer will have you dreaming of a sunny tropical beach with time to kill!
name: Tropical Burn
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A fresh take on our much lauded Brewers Reserve Double IPA, this beer has the addition of real blood orange and mango. Prepare for a citrus explosion on the nose and the palate with a small helping of dank. This IPA is big and in your face, but in a pleasant sort of way. With the addition of fruit, the citrus gets taken to the next level from start to finish. You may not be used to associating the word "refreshing" with a Double IPA. Well, here you go. Cheers!
name: Tropical Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Aloha my KIND friend, welcome to tropical paradise. We know you’ve been working hard so sit back and relax. Enjoy a blend of Summit, Falconers and Meridian hops, with a juicy blast of Mango and Passion Fruit. Mahalo!
name: Tropical Kind Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A tropical resinous bomb! Pours a rich, frothy head, and is deep amber in color, with tropical aromas that showcase guava, passion fruit and papaya notes, and a moderate sweetness in harmony with resinous tones. Well balanced and elegant! Brewed with Gambrinus Pale, Pilsner and Munich, Castle Caramel and Biscuit malts, Centennial, Cascade, Citra, and Summit hops, and our proprietary English yeast strain.
name: Tropical Thunder Double India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Trotter Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Troubadour Magma Special Edition Triple Spiked Brett
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: cask, special
name: Tryst Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Made with Ella Hops from Australia
name: TUPPS For Ella
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A bold, brash & unrefined Imperial IPA. The name, Loutish Madras, pays tribute to the historical "Port of Madras" where some of the first IPA’s that were brewed to survive the voyage from England to India may have crossed during the British colonization of India.
name: Tusk & Grain Loutish Madras
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Twelve Oaks
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Twenty One
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Stand up and be counted for what you are about to receive… an explosive ordinance of IBUs!

This Cascadian citrus hop bomb is sure to satisfy the most die-hard of hop heads.

For those who crave hop- we salute you!
name: Twenty Pounder Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: While the legend of Mad Tom is laden with mystery and intrigue, one thing remains clear - Mad Tom did things his own way. Twice as Mad Tom is an aggressively twice dry-hopped Imperial India Pale Ale, that delivers a definitive hop aroma and unabashedly big bold flavor. We brew this beer with the road less traveled in mind, and in the spirit of old Mad Tom, we make no bones about it.
name: Twice As Mad Tom IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Twice As Rice
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Twice Told
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our double IPA. Double the boom and double the cha-cha ching. Thanks to the Chinook hops this double IPA has a fruity Apricot/Peachy front end and a hop character that you would expect from a balanced double IPA.
name: Twin Cannons
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An intensely hoppy, very strong pale ale.  Grapefruit citrus notes on your nose, and a delicious resinous finish.  Just be warned...this one packs a punch!
name: Twin Slugger
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Twin Tip
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Brewed with Fresh-pressed Florida Sugar Cane, this DIPA is a nice balance between malty, hoppy, and dry with a perceived sweetness and mouthfeel!
name: Twist of Cane DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Back in orbit for a VERY short while. Outta-this-world single-hop, double IPA, showcasing the Galaxy hop. Weighs in at a theoretical 170 IGUs (that’s “Intergalactic Bittering Units”)
name: Twisted Galaxy
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A brazenly hop-forward beast of a beer, with a huge passionfruit nose. A subtle caramel character provides a malt backbone to shoulder the massive amount of dry-hopping that gives this beer its unique aroma and hop flavor. Two 5 Left is the runway that sends planes screaming right over El Segundo. We always knew we would name a beer after this local landmark and when it came to naming our first Double IPA, it fit the bill perfectly.
name: Two 5 Left DIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A brew for serious hop heads! A beautiful combination of malts and hops give this double IPA a big malty body with a nice punch of bitterness and slightly warming finish
name: Two Buttes Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Two Captains
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: It’s a double decocted, double fermented, double the amount of hops that went into making it for a dry hop, aged on medium toasted oak chips, Imperial IPA. 176 ibu’s and at 10.5% ABV.
name: Two Face
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Two Headed Rooster
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Once known as Pilot #6/OJIPA, this unfiltered beer is a New England style IPA with juicy flavors imparted by Citra, Mandarina Bavaria and other hop varieties.
name: Two Juicy
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Two Legit IIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This brew is a hop-head’s dream! The Citra hop variety lends bright, tropical citrusy notes, and is well complemented by the rich, slightly sweet background. This is an all-around big beer, in every way.
name: Two Suns Citra IIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A massively hopped Imperial IPA brewed to celebrate Valley Brews 10th anniversary. 1 pound of hops were added every 10 minutes during a 100 minute boil, a total of 10 different boiling hops. 4 different fresh hops were used in the hopback and then the beer was passed through a chamber containing 10 lbs of fresh hops on the way from the serving tanks to the bar taps. Hopperiffic.
name: Uberhoppy Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Ulriken
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This straw colored ale is all about the fragrant, pungent and citrusy American hops—grapefruit in a glass. A true West Coast IPA, balance be double damned!
name: UN-Balanced Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Un-Human Cannonball
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A bone-shatteringly juicy double IPA brewed with Simcoe, Mosaic, & Crystal Rye Malt.
name: Under Crown
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
We view Oval as a classic underdog, going for broke in the craft-beer world. For that reason, the Underdog IIPA (one of our first brews) holds a special place in our hearts. You may not be expecting much, but this Underdog will surprise you. It lands a haymaker of intense piney and citrusy aroma from our All American hops.

Brewed with All American Malts, and copius ammounts of Summit, Citra, Simcoe, Cascade, and Chinook hops. Dry hopped with Simcoe and Citra prior to kegging/canning to give you a face full of citrus and piney aromas. Coming in at 9.2% abv, this Underdog is not to be taken lightly.
name: Under Dog
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Under Tow
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: At the Southern Tier Brewing Company, vigorously hopped beer is our standard and inspiration. We continue a commitment to innovation with our most aggressive offering yet. Unearthly is a manifestation of the brewer’s craft; skillfully balancing art and the forces of nature to produce a divine liquid. Delicately pour a taste into a fluted glass. Smell the enchanting aromas of the hops waft forward as your first sip divulges this beer’s fervent soul. To underestimate Unearthly is to trifle with the mysteries of the universe, so please consume wisely.
name: Unearthly
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: In 750ml corked caged bottles this will be and unfiltered, fully bottle conditioned version of the super popular Double Simcoe. Expect Cask taste in a bottle, with more pronounced hoppy flavor and aroma due to being unfiltered. Also, carbonation will be a bit higher as is usual in our cork n cage series in keeping with tradition. It all comes together to form a uniquely great experience for hopheads.
name: Unfiltered Double Simcoe IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Unicorn Hits Rock Bottom
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The assassin of the east may have drawn first blood, but the mythical horned beast is back for UNICORN’S REVENGE. Grazing on fruity and floral New Zealand hops, this vindictive double IPA drives a horn through straight through the heart of any Ninja brazen enough to stand in the way of its peerless flavor. Behold! Beyond the piles of lifeless Ninja bodies a rainbow will rise, and on its breast, this rampaging beast of a beer will have its revenge!
name: Unicorn's Revenge
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
A Double IPA to make your senses take notice! Six
varieties of hops combine with UK Maris Otter and Crystal malts to make this an unforgettable experience!
name: UnObtainium
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The biggest and baddest IPA we've ever made, but with the satisfying drinkability of a Revolution beer. It may look and feel like a sessionable beer, but it ain't. Six hop varieties including tons of Galaxy infuse this giant IPA with flavors and aromas of pine, passion fruit, and citrus rind. With a surprisingly dry and crisp finish, this is the most drinkable imperial IPA you'll likely ever have. Drink it fresh.
name: Unsessionable
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Meaning to be “under hopped”, as to not having enough beer in one’s system (urban dictionary.com will back me up on this). This German inspired double I.P.A. is loaded with noble hops like Hallertau and Tettnang for an old world twist on the 21st century fascination
name: Unterhopft
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Up the Creek is mashed at a low temperature to increase the amount of fermentable sugars while reducing residual sweetness. This creates a hoppy behemoth of a beer with its alcohol well hidden. UTC is designed to be dangerously drinkable, so use caution or you’ll find yourself Up the Creek!

Malts: 2-Row Pale, Carmel 20, Special B, Carmel 120
Hops: Warrior, Nugget, Amarillo, Willamette
name: Up The Creek Extreme IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
This beer is an expression of our love for hops and the Imperial IPA style. It will evolve round-to-round based on seasonal availability and the brewer’s whim. It will always be bold, always courageous. I’d get some ice on that jaw if I were you.
 
Round 2:
Round 2 is a heavily fruit laden affair. With massive amounts of US Belma backed by Chinook, Amarillo, Eldorado and Kohatu this one has tipped the scales at over 1kg of hops per keg. Strawberry, pineapple, rockmelon, orange flesh and fennel all jump from the glass. Mash hopped, first wort hopped, hopped throughout the boil and whirlpool, in primary and bright.
name: Uppercut Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Single hop beer brewed with palisade hops.
name: Vache Folle Palisade
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Single hop beer.
name: Vache Folle Simcoe
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Valkyrie
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Apricot ginger Imperial IPA that uses apricot puree and ginger brewed in collorabation with Cigar City.
name: Vapricot
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: VB Double GeeBee India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Using a hop bill consisting of all Southern Hemisphere grown varietals, Vegemite Sandwich offers a unique take on the style lending aromas and flavors of pineapple and tangerines.
name: Vegemite Sandwich
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Vehopciraptor
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Velohoptor
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Verb The Noun
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Vic Secret Space Cake
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: es, with a name like that it could be a Member of the British Parliament or the hero in series of detective novels. But we’re going with our most handsome brewer, Joey Siconolfi—whose last name actually means “Victorious Wolf.”  In honor of Joey, in honor of his last name and his heritage, we brewed a very special beer.  It’s as epic as the name, loaded with Centennial, Citra and Casade hops, making it a bitter, high alcohol (11%ABV) content, citrusy bomb.
name: VIctorious Wolf
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Victory Nor Defeat
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Village Green is intensely hopped with six hop varieties that offer a cornucopia of aromas ranging from passion fruit, peach, and pineapple to grapefruit and lemon zest. We use English Maris Otter to balance the intense hop aromas producing a malt-balanced East Coast version of a Double IPA.
name: Village Green Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: I the undersigned do hereby pledge my undying thirst to this hoppy concoction of malt, water, and yeast.  By drinking this Double IPA, I agree that the contract is sealed, and Villain's fiendish deed shall be done.
name: Villain
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Violent Trubulence
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Literally “green king,” this Imperial IPA is all about the hops. Citra, Centennial, & Amarillo come together to create a fragrant and floral nose that expresses papaya, lime blossom, Juicy Fruit bubblegum, mango, and more. With little malt character to speak of, Viridi Rex walks the line between being excessively hoppy, without being excessively bitter.
name: Viridi Rex
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Viven Imperial IPA is originally from the west coast of America. This recipe, combined with the Flemish brewing art, has an excellent result. It does many beer lovers' hearts beat faster. It is a bitter hunk with a beautiful balance of citrus keys (especially pink grapefruit) and floral tones. A true experience for the senses…

Hops: Tomahawk + Simcoe
name: Viven Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Vixnu
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Voo Ka Ray (aka Vieux Carre’) IPA is a beautifully balanced yet Hop-centric Imperial IPA that avoids the extra bitterness found in many IPAs with similar hop levels & IBUs through the use of “Late Hopping”, which allows for the flavor and aroma of the hops to be prevalent without the extra bitterness found when using large amounts of hops. This allows the full bodied malt profile to perfectly balance the hops, which is not something found in your typical IPA.
name: Voo Ka Ray IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Vue Sur L'Amer
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Vulgar Display
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our American-style IPA is packed with Summit and Columbus hops and finished with Cascades, including dry hops in the fermenter. It has an intense bitter character, nice grapefruit aroma andserved unfiltered to bring out all that hoppy goodness.
name: W.H.A.L.E.S. Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The blending of hop varietals can create a plethora of different aromas and flavors that can hit you all at once, or come in luscious lupulin waves. To apply depth and character, a blend of citrus-rich Pacific Northwest hops and fruity Australian/New Zealand varietals are used in many different points through the brewing and fermentation of this ale. Waka Waka Waka is brewed with a touch of caramel malt and oats to bring a light malty backbone. Named after Fela Kuti, not Fozzie Bear.
name: Waka Waka Waka
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: 4/20 Special Double IPA
name: Waldo's Special Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Balanced and crisp, our easy drinking double IPA impacts flavors of citrus combined with a refreshing bitterness.
name: Walter
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The Legend of the Wampus Cat, spawned in Appalachia from Cherokee Indian folklore, depicts a half-woman, half-mountain lion that reportedly walks on hind legs and has four additional sharp-clawed appendages. This creature from American folklore, along with Strangeways Triple IPA, share the predestined ability to drive people crazy. Attempts at courage will likely be futile, as glowingly hypnotic eyes and an astounding seven different hop varietals wield their dominance and potency. First in the Annihilation Series, Wampus Cat Triple IPA should be treated with utmost caution, if the rare fortune to confront one presents itself.
name: Wampus Cat Triple IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An uppercut from Ella hops with no malt to block its fruity and citrus punch. Strong tropical aroma that finishes dry and crisp, the way an IPA should.
name: Wanderlust
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Wängbär
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
War Elephant is as unapologetic as Double IPAs get. At over 4lbs. of hops per barrel, War Elephant contains a completely irrational amount of hops designed to create a unique hop experience. It has a “smack-you-in-the-face” hop aroma consisting of pine needles, grapefruit, tangerine, and other citrus fruits. Unlike many other Double IPAs, though, War Elephant has a subdued malt character so it’s never cloyingly sweet, and at 80 IBUs it isn’t overly bitter. Like all Rushing Duck beers, War Elephant is unfiltered so as not to strip any of the precious hop aromas from the beer. As a result it has a hazy golden color with a thick rocky head.

The name: War Elephants date back the 4th century BC in India where elephants were bred and trained to fight in an “elephant cavalry” as transport, but also as a weapon used to stampede the enemy. Unconfirmed rumors suggest that the elephants were sometimes given fermented beverages as a means to make them more aggressive as well as feel numb to injuries of war. Rushing Duck Brewing in no way encourages you to feed beer to elephants or any other animal, nor do we encourage animal fighting…but it is a pretty cool story.
name: War Elephant
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Columbus Tomahawk Zeus is the primary hop variety in War Hammer as well as the inspiration in the name. We use a combination of Pacific Northwest hops to create layers of pungent flavors. A generous malt bill adds biscuit and honey notes while allowing the hops to take center stage. War Hammer pours golden in color with aromas of pineapple, mango, tangerine, resin, and slight earthy notes. Drink Fresh!
name: War Hammer Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This double IPA will make you want to grow a mullet (if you don’t already have one) and go to war (if you’re haven’t already).
name: War Mullet
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our newest IPA is dry and bright with the golden hue of a fading day. What starts as a faint hum builds to a roaring crescendo as the War Pigeons take to the sky. A telegraphed warning comes over the wire, but it’s too late. You’ve been hit. We deployed the freshest hops in our hop arsenal and the payload is a blast of dank, floral citrus. Surrender to the aromatic blitzkrieg as the hops rain down.
name: War Pigeon Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Brewed with American 2-Row, Caramel, and Munich malts, spiked with a healthy addition of Piloncillo sugar. Loads of Warrior & Citra hops for bittering and flavor, topped with Cascade for aroma. Careful.
name: Warlander
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Warlord is a monster of a beer. It's the most heavily dry-hopped beer we've ever made. The caramel and slight notes of apricot come from the generous user of domestic and British malts and although it has a bitterness of 85 IBU's it is still well balanced. Do not operate farm machinery.
name: Warlord India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our Watermelon Dorado Double IPA is not one to back down from big flavors. Mash, kettle, and dry hopping blend to create a huge hop profile that is balanced with a blast of watermelon. The result is a refreshing brew that is all summer and no seeds.
name: Watermelon Dorado
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Weapons Grade
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: WeedEater
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A dry, refreshing DIPA. Floral grapefruit aroma and flavors with a clean crisp finish. Not extremely bitter, but with a strong hop flavor.
name: Weedy’s
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: You like them RED, BIG & Hoppy?! This Double Red/DIPA is a Centennial and Cascade-hopped behemoth that gives some unique citrus and resiny flavors/aromas.
name: West-Coast Glutton
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Wet Benny
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: 20 pounds of fresh, wet, green Simcoe hops went into this 7bbl batch of Cant Dog. So grapefruity & tasty. On tap 9/20, around until 10/15. Only available @ Three Tides on tap.
name: Wet Dog
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: What The Floc
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A beer that "celebrates" those who complain that they cannot get a taste of Russian Rivers Pliny the Young. Featuring 8 hop varieties, this big satisfying ale has just the right amount of malt backbone to support the bold flavors.
name: Whiny the Complainer
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our fourth year-round brew, released at our three-year anniversary in 2014.  Plenty of American hop badassery and a mix of sweet, sweet malts to balance the 80 IBUs. Spicy rye and bready Munich lend a fantastic compliment to Whipsaw’s dank citrus bitterness.
name: Whipsaw
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Big juicy American hops burst from this Double IPA. Whistle Punk has an abundance of tropical fruit, citrus and pine aroma and flavor from the great hop blend. It will be released several times throughout the year. Look for it in 16 oz. 4 pack cans. Our brewpubs should have some in inventory today!
name: Whistle Punk
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: “White Knuckle Ale” is a Double India Pale Ale. That’s right, twice the malt and twice the hops in one 14 barrel batch. It is named in honor of the exciting bike trail on Mt. Tam. If you’re a “hophead ”, this is ones for you; fat, chewy, resiny, and pungent! Pour into a wide-mouthed glass and get ready to rip!
name: White Kunckle Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: White Out Imperial India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: White Sand Imperial India Pale Ale is the light colored twin of Black Sand Imperial India Pale Ale.  Use of malts much lighter in roast allows the profound addition of summit, cascade, amarillo and other rare finishing hops to be clearly accentuated.  This is a crisp and floral IPA.
name: White Sand IIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Whole in the Head Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Without a doubt the hoppiest mother of a brew we have ever created. More than 50 lbs. of Washington State Cascade and Columbus hops are infused, injected, or otherwise inflicted upon a single batch. Welcome to hop country!

Bronze Medal - North American Beer Awards - 2004
NW Brewing New - Voted Best Double IPA - 2005
name: Whoop Pass Double India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: WHYBO
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Widowmaker
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Wild & Wonderful Series #1 Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: So I hear you like hops? We call this an Octuple IPA because it sounds about as ridiculous as this beer is. Among the hops in this beer, you could make a solid IPA with 1/8 of the hops that are in this monster. With over 10Lbs of hops per barrel and more than a dozen different hops this beer is one huge hop bomb. It has a pleasant citrus and fruity aroma with a piney slightly sweet flavor. Try some at your own risk.
name: Wild Bill's Octuple IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
A very drinkable Super Imperial IPA.  Pronounced but nicely balanced hop profile. Pours amber red, with a thick white head.  Subtle notes of orange are present but fade quickly.

Her Story: The story of Wilma’s Wandering EyePA begins at home at the Lane house. As a hophead, Cheryl insisted that Larry create an Imperial IPA with a slight floral nose and boy did she get it! This beer is so drinkable that it’s easy to forget about its high ABV . . . which leads to the name! Tread lightly or you too could end up with a wandering eye.
name: Wilma's Wandering EyePA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Wingnut
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Named for an IPA-happy guy we know, this is our first double IPA. Extra pale, dry, brewed exclusively with continental pilsner malt, and Horizon, Chinook, Centennial, and Falconer's Flight hops.
name: Winkleman
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An aggressively hopped and dangerously drinkable Imperial IPA. Liberal amounts of Chinook and Simcoe hops are the basis for a sticky, dank, piney, and resinous hop-bomb. A solid malt backbone and the addition of 120 pounds of raw Clover Honey rounds out the high hop intensity, bringing balance and a touch of sweetness.
name: Winnie the Brew
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A Double IPA based on the Flat 12 Half Cycle IPA, Winter Cycle is a big hop bomb of an IPA featuring 8 different hops, from 3 continents. Juniper berries add a subtle winter kick. Big hop, sneaky big ABV - it's like Half Cycle's pissed off viking cousin.
name: Winter Cycle Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: IPA brewed with local fresh spruce trimmings.
name: Wintergreen IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Folklore and mythology present the raven as an omniscient creature with special powers and abilities. The Wisdom Seeker Double IPA gets its special powers from an enormous amount of hops and malted barley. Brewed in the West coast Double IPA style, this bold brew features massive citrus and herbal hop additions and a full hop aroma. Seek your wisdom cautiously; this hop feast packs a punch.

Malt: ESB pale malt
Hops: Nugget, Chinook, Centennial, Simcoe, Amarillo, Summit, Citra
name: Wisdom Seeker Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
What is a Session DOUBLE IPA?
What can I say – I like my hops like I like my beers: on the big side. So if you know Shmaltz’s portfolio, you’ll know 8% is a lil bigger than our regulars but still a bit smaller than huge. Thus a “Session” Double IPA. Don’t be bitter, Baby. Just enjoy. Brewed to highlight the citrusy and tropical hop qualities we love, WISHBONE will be the perfect summer sipper for hop heads everywhere.
name: Wishbone Session Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Imperial India Pale Ale (IIPA)

Generally an IPA is a beer that focuses on hop aroma and hop bitterness – and double IPAs, as you could imagine, are even more amplified in both bitterness and alcohol content. Our interpretation of this aggressive style, the Witchshark, is a bit of a favourite around here. Named after the elusive creature with the head of a shark and the body of a boy that first swooped in on a broom during construction of the brewery, this imperial IPA can elevate a bad day to good. The Witchshark is shy and mischievous, but once you let him into your heart you’ll see why this intense brew is a favourite among our patrons and brewers.
name: Witchshark
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Wolf's Den Double India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Wonderlust
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Woods Hippy Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Working For The Weekend
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Big, bold and worldly without being imperious, this hop rocket offers a smooth ride into the ether where the angels await with open arms. Hop lovers rejoice! Eight Willamette Valley hop varieties - count ‘em: 8. We dry-hopped the bejeesuz into this aromatic wonder.  A mouth-watering 5.5 pounds of hops per barrel.
name: Worthy Imperial IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: American Double IPA with face-melting citrusy, resinous American hop character and a light caramel malt backbone.
name: Wreckagemaster
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: The citrus, tropical fruit and pine flavors come from 4 varieties of hops, sourced from two continents. It's grain bill and yeast come from another two continents, making this 8.0% ABV and 87 IBU Beer a truly World-Wide Pale Ale.
name: WWPA Double IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
A cross between Imperial India Pale Ale, Northwest Pale Ale, and American Pale Ale.  This unique Pale is as big as Wyoming.  Many large additions of hops during the boil make this ale a hit with the hop lovers of pale ales.  We use Galena, Nugget, Challenger, UK Golding, Willamette, Cascade, and Whitbread Kent Golding Hops in this beer.  It is dry hopped with a good dose of Cascade and UK Golding hops.

2007 Silver Medal North American Beer Awards Imperial Pale Ale Category
2012 People’s Choice Lander Beer Festival
name: Wyoming Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Our 10th Anniversary Ale, “X”, is only available in hand bottled 750 ml Cobalt Blue Swing Top Bottles. Hand dated, numbered and signed. It is and Imperial India Pale Ale brewed with 10 kinds of malt, 10 kinds of hops and then dry hopped with 10 kinds of hops.
name: X
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Above and beyond an India Pale Ale--I2PA is radically hopped with an intense aroma and hop bitterness. Unfiltered and aged for 9 months before it leaves the brewery--not for the faint of heart. I2PA is brewed with two-row Pipkin Pale malts, Saaz, Cascade and Northwest Golding hops. I2PA is available in a new 750ml Silkscreened black ceramic bottle and on draft.
name: XS Imperial India Pale Ale
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Saints be praised! Due to the enormous amount of customers that requested the XVIth Chapel to be back on tap, the brewers at Fort George couldn’t help but comply. The XVIth Chapel is technically a double IPA fermented with a flamboyant strain of Belgian yeast.   The brewer’s skill is put to the test in order to finesse the bitter and aromatic hop profile with the fruity esters produced during the long fermentation cycle. With plenty of delicious Galena, Centennial, and Amarillo hops to balance out the spice of the farmhouse yeast, the XVIth is a perfect blend of bitter and sweet.  You will be on your knees praising the beer gods over this earthy double IPA.

 

XVIth Chapel: Roses on Roses

Take the XVIth Chapel, age it in Four Roses Bourbon Barrels, condition it on rose hips and more hops.  Available for a limited time in 22oz bottles.  Happy 5th anniversary!

Five years ago we opened a little brewpub in the downstairs corner of The Fort George Building in Historic Downtown Astoria. Today we take up nearly and entire city-block: , three buildings, two breweries, two bars, an event space, and a canning line with all run by almost 50 hard-working employees. 

With a beer in the plans for almost as long as we’ve been operational, this is our expression of what a brewery can accomplish in five short but intense years. 

May we still be pleasing your palate in another five.
name: XVIth Chapel
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: An industrial strength IPA for the "Hop Heads" This Imperial style IPA will satisfy all your Hop needs. Aged on Rye Whiskey Oak Barrel.
name: XXX-Tra Filthy IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Y2b is a limited edition brew to celebrate our second anniversary. The malts were carefully chosen to produce subtle caramel flavors that provide a strong base and balance for the copious amount of hops exhibited in this beer. The beer explodes with fruity, spicy, earthy, and zesty aromatics. Eight different varieties of hops: Citra, Mosaic, Tradition, Summit, Magnum, Warrior, Zythos, and Simcoe provide tropical fruit flavors of mandarin, passion fruit, peach, orange, and mango, that awaken your palate. Full bodied, with an alcoholic sweetness. Finishes with a clean bitterness
name: Y2B (Year 2 Beer)
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This is one half of a Black and Tan. Not just any Black and Tan, but the one where a toasted smug and a hoppy fella get together to make a sublime Taiji balance. Mix the Yang & Yin together (or enjoy this flipping good Imperial IPA solo).
name: Yang
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: This Imperial IPA was brewed to celebrate our first anniversary. Think of it as a liquid “thank you” to all of you who have believed in us and supported our dream. Thank you all! as long as you’re with us, every year will be the Year of the Ox. Cheers!
name: Year of the Ox
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
Wranglers aren't just your dad's brand of blue jeans. As brewers, we spend lots of time cultivating and herding yeast from tank to tank and batch to batch. Us hombres at Holy City fancy ourselves yeast wranglers...

... and it took some serious yeast wrangling to ferment this 10% ABV behemoth to completion. The aggressive nose is courtesy of a dry hop with Centennial, Cascade, and Mosaic. Those three varieties are joined by Warrior and Citra in the boil for an all-out alpha acid assault. Put on your big boy pants/blue jeans for this one.
name: Yeast Wrangler
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: With over 100 IBUs Yellow Wolf has enough eye-popping intensity to satisfy even the most ardent hopheads. It has bright piney nose and light golden color. We suggest pairing it with sunshine.
name: Yellow Wolf
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Even on your crankiest days, this Super IPA will have you doing a happy dance in no time. Our deliciously hoppy ale smells great, and its smooth flavor is perfect for hitting the “paws” button on your crazy-busy day. It may be served in a proper snifter to capture its aroma, but this is our biggest, boldest beer to date. If you never thought the word ‘yippy’ would leave your lips, remember -- there’s a first time for everything.
name: Yippy IPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Every year we anxiously await the warmer months to unleash this Double IPA, the summer edition of our YuleSmith seasonals. The flavor imparts orange, grapefruit, and tangerine hop notes with earthy, spicy, and resinous pine undertones. A sturdy malt backbone balances out the profound hop bitterness to create a refreshingly assertive and vibrant beer that offers an unapologetically bold expression of fresh American hops.
name: Yule Smith – Summer
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: December  2011 - Zacks IIPA - designed by Homebrewer Zach Frasher from the Grass Valley/Auburn area. Zacks American Double India Pale Ale is a bursting hop forward citrus and floral hop bomb that finishes dry with a touch of sweetness.  Bittered with medium level Cohumulone bittering hops giving this DIPA a little more hop bite.
name: Zacks IIPA
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: Grown from humble beginnings. . . born of two cultures. . . Zapata Bot is New England Brewery’s famed Gandhi Bot--aged in tequila barrels for an extra kick. Guaranteed to cause a revolution in your mouth. Viva Zapata Bot! Editor’s note: The beer spent six weeks in the barrel, and was dry-hopped with Simcoe and Ahtanum hops throughout. Limited to 713 bottles at the brewery.
name: Zapata Bot
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: Ziggy's Royal Stardust
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description:
ZZ Hop triple IPA was brewed as a tribute to a true hop fanatic who is known in these parts as “The Hop Hunter”. The allusive bearded Sierra Hop Hunter can be found in the mountainous regions of Northern California. While not officially nocturnal, he prefers to hunt hops in low light conditions for extended periods of time.

Triple the hop iSOBERization from three different forms of Chinook, Centennial and Amarillo hops. An intense floral and piney aroma with an explosion of hop flavor quickly turns to sharp bitterness followed by a brief encounter with malted barley.

One sip will make your tongue feel like a hop oil spill has occurred just past your lips.
name: ZZ Hop
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

name: ¿HOPITITIS?
style: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
